loans.name: Livanisa

texts.en:
Livanisa is a 45-year-old divorced woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. After the breakup with her husband, she had to assume total responsibility for her children, and her desire is to see them graduate with degrees.

For three years Livanisa has been selling clothes, using her income to pay her children's school fees and buy land for farming. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet the varied tastes and preferences of her customers are her major challenges. Now requesting this loan facility to buy clothes ahead of the Christmas season, Livanisa's business dream is to establish a modern boutique in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
Daisy es parte del grupo Espiritu Santo, ella se dedica a la peluquería, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y que suela con ir agrandando su negocio para poder así también ayudar a otras personas.
El grupo Espiritu Santo tiene 12 mujeres, donde todas ellas son jefas de familia, que desean luchar por los suyos y dar a sus hijos todo lo que pueden para una buena educación.
La Sra. Daisy solicita este crédito para la compra de spray, gel, tijeras, y otros insumos que ella va a usar para seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daisy is part of the communal bank "Espiritu Santo," and she has a beauty salon business.  She is a very enterprising woman who is working to expand her business so that she can also help other people.

The "Espiritu Santo" communal bank is made up of 12 women, all of whom are head of households who strive to give their children everything they can so that they can get a good education.

Daisy is requesting a loan to buy hair spray, gel, scissors and other supplies that she will use to continue to provide good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy hair spray, gel, scissors and other supplies for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make her dishes.

loans.name: Real Atahuallpa Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Real de Atahuallpa” en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco. Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de habas, venta bebidas calientes, venta de cosméticos y venta de comida otros socios se dedican a la brindar servicio de cocina, mantenimiento de carros, albañil, cocinero, trasportista. 

(La señora Delia esta levantando la mano en la fotografia). 
Delia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se dedica a vender desayunos y hacer llamadas en los alrededores de uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Su esposo de Delia se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en la ciudad del Cusco en su propio carro asi de esta manera ayuda en la canasta familiar. En esta oportunidad Delia requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro o sea va comprar llantas. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La socias que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
“Real de Atahuallpa” is a Communal Bank who has been created by a group of friends and neighbors living in Puno, a department of the district and province of Cusco. This Communal Bank has been working for a few years now, and it is well organized. This Communal Bank is composed of people who constantly look for occasions to progress in life, and who grant a better future to their children thanks to their daily efforts. Some of the members engage in selling broad beans, hot drinks, cosmetics and food, while others engage in providing cooking services, in repairing vehicles, and in offering their services as masons, cooks and truck drivers.

Delia is the lady in the picture with her hand raised.

Delia was born in Cusco, and she lives in the same town where she was born. She engages in selling breakfasts and in providing calling services in the outskirts of one of the most popular markets in Cusco. She has been engaging in this activity for a few years already, and things are going very well. Delia’s husband provides public transportation services in the town of Cusco with his own vehicle, thus helping with the household expenses. In this occasion, Delia is requesting a loan to provide maintenance to the vehicle by buying tires.

The members are grateful for the chance they have been given and they commit to complying with the repayment of their different dues according to schedule. The members appearing at the bottom of the picture have arrived late at the meeting.

loans.use: To buy tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea  ella es casada  y tiene 56 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que más le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de confección de ropa, venta de comida, restaurante, carpinteria, artesania, venta de muebles, crianza de animales menores, venta de ropa.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Senor de Huanca de Cusco", which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Andrea.  She is 56 years old, married, and has five children.  Andrea divides her time between her daily activities and managing her business of buying and selling small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She has been in this business for years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day.  Andrea raises the animals from the time they are young until they are ready to be sold to her customers who request them.  She is a responsible and industrious person who works in order to help her family move forward.  Andrea is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs for her business.

The other group members have businesses that involve making clothes, selling food, managing a restaurant, carpentry work, handicrafts, selling furniture, raising small animals, and selling clothes.  The smaller attached photo shows two members who requested permission to arrive late to the group meeting for work reasons.  

Andrea is grateful to everyone who helped to fulfill her dream in this manner.  She promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Santa Librada 2 Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación que se unieron para poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo salir adelante. Están en su segundo ciclo y desean seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Lourdes, ella tiene su despensa en su casa, y su negocio está creciendo día a día por medio del trabajo y sacrificio que hace. Su meta es poder tener el día de mañana un gran autoservice para poder seguir abasteciendo a su clientela.
Solicita del crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, enlatados, verduras y demás, y así seguir con su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
These 15 women from the city of Encarnación joined together so that they could work as a group and help one another get ahead. They are in their second loan cycle and want to keep growing.

One of the members is Sra. Lourdes, who operates a food pantry in her home. Her business is growing each day because of the work and sacrifice that she has invested. Lourdes’ goal for the future is to have a successful self-service shop that continues to provide products for her customers.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy beverages, food products, canned goods, vegetables, and other items so that she can keep her business well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food products, canned goods, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Mahoudjro 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUDJRO 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Mireille (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Lucien. Mireille est mère de quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Mireille vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a près de dix ans que Mireille vend divers articles et des condiments près d’une place publique du Bénin. Mireille mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Mireille s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mireille sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUDJRO 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Mahoudjro 2 is a group of three people, who are all friends and belong to the same savings group. The group’s representative is Mireille (pictured with her hand raised in the photo). She is 31 years of age, and is married to Lucien. Mireille has four children, some of whom are at school and all under the care of the couple. Mireille lives with her children and her husband, and together the couple makes sure that the various household expenses are covered.

Mireille has worked for almost 10 years selling miscellaneous articles and seasoning close to a public square in Benin. She has this business so that she can contribute to paying the household expenses, and gets her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to ensure customer satisfaction, she has asked for her first loan, along with the other members of the Mahoudjro 2 group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ requests, as well as to generate more profits.

loans.use: To buy various articles and seasoning.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y deseosa de progresar, está casada con Miguel. Juntos habitan a lado de sus tres hijos y sus dos nietos a los que quiere mucho, esta contenta de poder tenerlos cerca, su inmuebles esta hecho de material noble. La actividad que realiza Angélica es la venta de comidas tales como menús, y para desarrollar su trabajo ha establecido con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación un modesto restaurante en su casa. Realiza este negocio por más 7 años y trabaja con la ayuda de otra persona quien le apoya en la atención a los clientes que ha logrado consolidar gracias a la buena sazón que pone en cada uno de los platillos que ofrece. Complementa cada platillo con la venta de gaseosas y otras bebidas heladas. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le brinda buenos ingresos económicos y eso le ayuda a solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar, además se siente muy contenta generando su propia fuente de trabajo. Por fortuna su negocio ha tenido buena acogida por los clientes y es por eso que desea brindarles una mayor comodidad y mantener la calidad y el buen sabor de los potajes que ofrece. Este es el préstamo número 12 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará algunos artículos de cocina que desea renovar como ollas, cucharones, platos, tazas, vasos y sartenes.
texts.en:
Angélica, 48, is a hardworking woman who wants to make progress.  She’s married to Miguel and they live with their three children and two grandchildren she loves very much.  She’s happy to be able to have them nearby.  Her house is made of substantial materials.  

Angélica’s activity is cooking food like complete meals and to do so has established with much effort and dedication a modest restaurant at home.  She’s been in business for more than 7 years and works with help of another person who helps her with customer service.  She’s acquired a good clientele thanks to the tasty way she prepares the dishes she offers.  She complements each dish with the sale of soft-drinks or other cold beverages.  

What she likes about her activity is that it produces good income which helps her cover basic household expenses.  She also feels very happy generating her own source of employment.  Fortunately, her business has been well-received by her customers and this is why she’d like to offer them improved comfort and to maintain the good quality and flavor of the dishes she prepares.  

This will be her 12th MFP loan and she’s very grateful for the credit opportunity she’s being offered and for the financial backup she needs to continue forward.  She commits to make her monthly installment payments punctually and to continue working very responsibly with her fellow communal bank members.  She will use the 1,500 new soles to buy some kitchen utensils she needs to replace like pots, ladles, dishes, cups, glasses and pans.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils like pots, ladles, dishes, cups, glasses and pans.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y muy amable, le gusta los retos. Convive con  Manuel, y fruto de esa unión tienen 2 hijos. Actualmente habitan en su propia casa en compañía de su hija Farol de 22 años de edad. Ella lucha día a día para darles lo mejor.
El negocio que tiene Irma es la venta de comidas, actividad que realiza cada fin de semana, siendo su centro de trabajo en un pequeño espacio que acondiciono en la vereda de su casa, ofreciendo platos regionales como juanes, pollos fritos, asados y otros. Atiende siempre de manera amable y cordial a su distinguida clientela. Su actividad empieza desde muy temprana para ir a comprar los ingredientes, que le serviran en la preparación de estos platillos. Ya  lleva más de 16  años en éste negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su hija para atender al público. Considera que su trabajo es bastante rentable, por la clientela constante que ha mantenido gracias a la buena sazón de sus comidas. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, asegura que es una actividad que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico más de lo debido y eso le permite seguir adelante, desea que su trabajo permanezca estable para que continúe trabajando. Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado de 1,500 nuevos soles comprará víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de una mayor variedad de platillos, también comprará gaseosas.
texts.en:
Irma, 54, is an enterprising woman who is cheerful and very friendly.  She lives with Manuel, and together they have 2 children.  They currently live in their own home with their daughter, Farol, who is 22 years old.  She struggles each day to give her family the best. 

Irma has a business selling food, an activity that she carries out every weekend.  She works in a small space that she set up on the sidewalk in front of her house, where she offers regional dishes such as "juanes" (a dish made from chicken and rice), fried chicken, grilled meat and other specialties.  She provides friendly service to her honored customers.  

Irma starts this work very early in the morning when she goes to buy the ingredients that she will use to prepare the dishes.  She has had this business now for over 16 years, and her daughter helps her tend to the public.  She considers this work to be quite profitable, because of the regular customers that she has maintained thanks to the good taste of her cooking.  She enjoys her business, as it has brought her both personal and financial satisfaction.  She says that this is an activity that doesn't require an excessive amount of physical exertion, and this allows her to continue forward with it.  She wants her business to remain stable so that she can keep on working.  

This is Irma's 4th loan with MFP, and she is very grateful for the loan opportunity that they are providing her, giving her the financial support that she needs to continue forward.  Irma promises to make her monthly payments on time, and to continue to work responsibly with the other members of her communal bank.  With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy groceries and ingredients to prepare a larger variety of dishes.  She will also buy soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy groceries and soft drinks for her food business

loans.name: Santos Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Santos Faustino está casado, tiene 24 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la tejeduría inicio este negocio con sus padres cuando era pequeño, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, y también  la compra de diamante de seda que es un adorno que agrega en sus tejidos. Espera en el futuro tener varios empleados y un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
Santos Faustino is married. He is 24 years old and didn't have a chance to go to school. He works in weaving and started this business with his parents when he was younger. He has five years of experience so far and his wife, who works the same trade, helps him. 

He is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase different types of threads in different colors and also to buy "silk diamonds" which he uses to embellish the fabrics he weaves. He hopes to have several employees and a profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 46 years old and married. She has one beautiful child, and Yasmeen’s world revolves around that child. Her husband is a painter whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of his family members.

Realizing this shortage of income, Yasmeen quickly adopted sewing as a second source of income for her household. She is now experienced enough to create all sorts of designs and so fulfill the demands and requirements of her customers.

Due to the changing season Yasmeen is getting more orders, so she needs to buy more spools of thread and packs of lace and buttons to complete her orders on time. She now is applying for a 15,000 PKR loan from Kashf to help in this respect.

Yasmeen will surely set aside money from her profits to better her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and packs of lace and buttons.

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.en:
Farhodjon, a 22-year-old married man, has always wanted to provide a good quality of life for his family. It is for this reason that he began his own taxi business five years ago. Thanks to his good service, Farhodjon has managed to gain many customers, and his family’s quality of life has been improving; their financial challenges are being solved little by little.

Farhodjon is requesting a loan to repair his car, which will enable him to provide better service and increase his income. This, in turn, will allow him to offer his family a better quality of life and greater opportunity to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: 3.14.196.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Thanh is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She supports 2 dependents with her business, which is located in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods for sale. 

In 2011, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business, and has successfully repaid 2 loans from them. She is the group leader of the 3.14.196.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. With her profits from this loan, Thanh hopes to improve her business, buy more supplies and equipment for it, and remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods for sale.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Isabel de las Nieves es la presidenta del grupo San Juan, el cual está en su primer ciclo. Ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y quieren poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
Isabel se dedica a la venta de ropas, y por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, ya que gracias a su trabajo tiene los ingresos para poder ayudarlos.  Es una persona con ganas de salir adelante y ser mejor en la vida.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de variadas clases, en especial de verano, para poder seguir vendiendo sus productos.
texts.en:
Isabel de las Nieves is the president of the communal bank "San Juan," which is in its first loan cycle.  This group is learning to work together, and they want to get to the highest level of the Enterprising Women program.

Isabel has a business selling clothing, and through this business she helps her family.  Thanks to her work, she has the income to help them.  She is a person who has a strong desire to better herself and get ahead in life.

Isabel is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of various kinds of garments, especially summer clothing, so that she can continue to sell products.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon to sell.

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en:
Tuong was born in 1975. She has two children. Her daughter is a student. Her son is a pupil in the 8th grade. Her husband is a carpenter. Tuong sells feed to earn a living. She earns 5,000,000 dong (VND) a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 dong (VND) per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 dong (VND) and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 dong (VND) to buy feed, fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to sell in her store. She wants to use the benefits from this loan to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fateh

texts.en: Fateh is a 23-year-old man who is single and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a person who is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic and has a great desire to succeed. By his own initiative, and with much effort and enthusiasm, his has an educational background and a diploma. He owns a house and intends to buy furniture but he doesn't have sufficient money so he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Rita Isabel Paola

texts.es:
Isabel es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, vive al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere mucho, Isabel es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante,  por ello día a día Isabel trabaja en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, con el cual puede ayudarse con los pagos de sus estudios superiores ya que actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, Isabel trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al dia ya que por las noches va a su centro de estudios; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es my responsable y sobre todo su carisma y sus ganas de hacer las cosas bien.

Isabel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar los gastos de su mensualidad, con lo cual podra aistir sin problemas a sus clases y poder seguir estudiando, asi ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño: “Ser una gran gran profesional y tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
Isabel is a young woman who is 19 years of age. She lives in the city of Ica with her parents who she loves dearly.

Isabel is a young woman who has the drive to succeed, so she works each day at a farming estate in the city in order to pay for her higher education. She is currently studying for a degree in Business Administration. Isabel works approximately eight hours a day and then attends classes at night. She believes she is doing well in her work because she is responsible, charismatic, and gives her best in everything she does.

Isabel is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to pay her monthly tuition installment so that she can attend her classes without problems and continue her studies. Isabel continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest dream of becoming a successful professional and owning a restaurant.

loans.use: to pay her monthly tuition installment.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Odgerel, 45, is the mother of two children, and lives with her family in a ger (the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). Her daughters, aged 18 and 17, are university students. She and her husband sell Japanese car parts at a local market. Her husband is an invalid but he is always helping his wife with the business. Odgerel started her business in 2005 with a working capital of 1,000,000 MNT and she has managed to increase it since then. They purchase their products once or twice a month. Since she started this business, Odgerel has been providing money for her family’s expenses and paying her children’s education fees. She is an open person who has very good communication skills. She says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children." She is requesting a 3,800,000 MNT loan to purchase more spare parts for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for her business

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling cassava flour for four years and works twelve hours a day. His business is located on a busy street, thus attracting many customers. He also earns extra income from his salary as a driver. His personal goal is to educate his children, build a house and buy land for farming while his business goal is to own a food store despite the challenges of stiff competition and lack of enough capital to meet the demands. Lawrence is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsendsuren is married and a 41-year-old entrepreneur who has been operating a national costume (the deel) sewing business at the largest outdoor market since 2001. She lives with her daughter and spouse in the outer ger district, which lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

She is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase more materials to sew more traditional Mongolian costumes.

loans.use: to purchase more material to sew more national costumes

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, who has a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town, used his previous loan from KADET LTD to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. It has enabled him to keep the motorcycle in good condition for his business and he has been paying the loan amount well and in good time.

This is his second loan. He plans to use the loan to buy another motorcycle for his business. This will enable him to make more income that he will use to buy another motorcycle and thereby expand his business.

He hopes to grow his transport business and buy a motor vehicle for his transport business in the future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso is 47 years old. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and an infant grandchild in a small village in the Senaki district. Her son works as a soldier and gets a monthly salary. The family’s main income comes from agricultural activities. Eliso has a milk cow and 2 calves. She milks the cow and produces cheese, which is sold locally in an open market at a good price. She also has a pig and sells piglets. In addition to this, she owns a hectare of land, where she sows maize. 

Eliso is a very hard working woman and does her best to ensure good harvests. She has requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. This will enable her to increase her cheese production. It will significantly increase the income of the family and thus they will improve their living conditions. Eliso awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a cereals seller in Nakuru town. She used her first loan from KADET LTD to buy beans, peas, dried maize, and rice to sell in her business.It was profitable and she was able to repay the loan.

Mary is requesting her second loan, which she will to use to buy more stock of cereals to sell, including rice, wheat, beans, and maize flour. She hopes to expand her business by opening another cereals shop and earning additional income so that she will be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, beans, and maize flour.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah sells spices and grocery items in Nakuru town, and it has been profitable. She used her previous loan amount to buy peas, spices, potatoes, and vegetables for sale, and she was able to repay all the loan amount.

This being her second loan term, she plans to buy more stocks of spices and cereals to sell.  These include maize, beans, and green grams. The spices include pepper, red onions, and tomatoes.

Serah hopes to grow her business and to be able to buy a plot to build commercial and rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices and cereals.

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en: Kevina is a 35-year-old single mother of four children living in Kasese, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not facilitate her to support her children, she ventured into clothing selling and has been in business for a year. With the income earned, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house. Weather changes affect her business since she operates in open market places, and her dream is to rent a house and set up a modern boutique. Kevina intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season where the demand is high.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Al-Badani Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Badani and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER.

Haia is a housewife and a very hardworking woman. She is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

She has a house. She needs a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials.

She wants to keep working very hard to be able to help her family and complete the building of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in their small and old wooden house in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity, in Erdenet the third largest city of Mongolia. 

Chuluunbaatar has been working for the Mongolian-Russian Erdenet Mining Corparation since 1999. This corporation is one of the biggest ore mining and processing factories in Asia. Chuluunbaatar is the one who earns income for his family. His daughter is a university student. His house is 24 square meters. Chuluunbaatar is planning to thicken his house walls with materials such as cement, brick, and glass-wool to stop the heat loss through them. So, Chuluunbaatar is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to thicken his house walls.

loans.use: to thicken his house walls

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en:
Petronilla is 30 years old and married, with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been selling clothes for two years, and the business is usually good during festive and summer holidays.  She began her business to give a helping hand to her husband who was bearing all the burden of the family's welfare on a meagre salary.  

She deals only in women's clothing because of the high demand.  Her dreams are to educate her children and expand her business to new areas, despite challenges of inadequate capital. 

Petronilla is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell as the Christmas season is fast approaching.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is single with two children who attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda. She has been selling charcoal at retail from her home for the last three years, working six days a week. She also sells cabbages, tomatoes, and vegetables to earn additional income.

Rosette is requesting a loan from MCDT SACCO for 300,000 UGX, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. Her major business challenges include increasing prices of charcoal and seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business and be able to supply charcoal to the retailers in her area. 

Rosette joined MCDT because the loans are easy to pay. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married lady, 31 years old, who is blessed with three children, whoi are 11, eight, and three years old.  She rears poultry in their farm and has been in operation for two years, earning her an income of KES 15,000 monthly.

She is servicing a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, this being her first loan.  She intends to use this amount to purchase more chicks to rear and sell in December.  It is a high season month, and she expects to sell more and earn more income.  

The amount will be used to repay her loan as well as ploughing back into her business. She hopes for prosperity in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She also helps support her sisters. Jane and her family live in a rental with access to both electricity and piped water. Their major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Jane has been selling potatoes, cassava, tomatoes and banana-leaf sweets by the roadside for the last four years. She works seven days a week. The seasonality involved in selling produce is a major challenge for her.

She joined MCDT-SACCO because she wanted to boost her business and to pay school fees for her child. She is applying for a loan of 300,000 UGX to enable her to sell more varieties of food. Her dream is to make more in profits so that she can buy some land.

loans.use: to buy and sell more varieties of food.

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es:
Alberto  de 53 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Estelí, casado, de oficio carpintero. El cuenta que antes tenía una panadería y después inicio como ayudante de otras personas, luego decidió establecer su propio negocio en donde su hijo le ayudo a comprar maquinas para la elaboración de sus productos. Actualmente  se dedica a la elaboración de muebles como sillas, comedores, roperos y  gabinetes.
Alberto solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima tales como pintura, lijas, barniz, pegamento etc. El estima que su crédito le será de mucha ayuda, ya que podrá invertir en su negocio para brindarles a sus clientes un  producto de calidad, sus planes futuros es ampliar su negocio mejorar la infraestructura de su taller.
texts.en:
Alberto is 53 years old and lives in the city of Estelí. He is married and works as a carpenter by trade. Alberto used to own a bakery and then started working as an assistant for other people. Later he decided to establish his own business, so his son helped him with buying machines in order to make his products. At the moment, Alberto produces furniture such as chairs, dining sets, wardrobes, and cabinets.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy raw materials such as paint, sandpaper, varnish, glue, and other supplies. Alberto believes this loan will be of great help since he will be able to invest in his business and provide his customers a quality product. His future plans include expanding his business and improving the infrastructure of his workshop.

loans.use: to buy paint, sandpaper, varnish, glue, and other supplies.

loans.name: G.s. Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es: G.S. Ríos de Agua Viva esta conformado por tres integrantes los cuales son: Ebelia, Mario, Jaime, los tres son casados, con 5 hijos menores de edad bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del departamento de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ellos se unieron con el objetivo de apoyarse mutuamente para ser beneficiados con el credito.tiene diferentes actividades económicas. Ebelia es la coordinadora del grupo solidario y tiene por negocio una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda con venta de productos comestible la cual vende en cantidades pequeña como: bolsitas de café, bolsitas de shaapo, pan, leche, frijoles, jugos enlatados, detergente, jabón. Desde hace 13 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. Y la tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos comestible. El grupo solidario Ríos de Agua Viva agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The ‘Ríos de Agua Viva’ [Rivers of Living Water] communal bank is comprised of three members, Ebelia, Mario, and Jaime.  All three of them are married with five minor children that are their responsibility.  They are from the León department, which is in the western area of the country.  They got together with the objective of mutually supporting each other in order to receive the benefit of this loan.  They have different business activities.

Ebelia is the coordinator of the group.  Her business is a mini-market that she has at her house.  This is a small store where she sells food products.  She sells things like small bags of coffee, small bags of shampoo, bread, milk, beans, canned juice, detergent, and soap.  She has been doing this for 13 years, and her business is in her home.

She needs the loan for working capital and to stock her store with food products.  

The Ríos de Agua Viva communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua so that the borrowers have the means to have a decent life.

loans.use: to stock her store by purchasing small bags of coffee, small bags of shampoo, bread, milk, beans, canned juice, detergent, and soap.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, who has a general shop in Nakuru town, also runs a clothing-selling business in Nakuru town. She used her previous loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in her general shop. It has been profitable and she has been paying the loan amount well and in good time.

This will be her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy clothes to sell and boost her clothing-selling business. She anticipates to make more profits because of the coming festive season as well as the high demands of her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her businesses and make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jean De La Paix

texts.en:
Jean de la Paix, 30, is married and has owned a taxi van business for two years. His business is well-organized, and he works from 5:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m every day.

Jean de la Paix is applying for a 500,000 RWF loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy tires and an engine to maintain his taxi van. He plans to reinvest his profits in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy tires and an engine for his taxi van.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en:
Aseel is 24 years old and from Tulkarem.

She is married and lives with her husband and two kids.

She owns a farm in which she raises cattle. She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more cattle and increase the space for the farm.

She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income in order to provide her kids with the best education.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and increase the space for the farm

loans.name: Adjeniya 3 Group

texts.fr: ADJENIYA 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Bachachath Laï Abolorè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Bassitou. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Bachachath Laï Abolorè a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a près d’une dizaine d’année que Bachachath Laï Abolorè mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (sachets, savons) dans sa région. Bachachath Laï Abolorè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Bachachath Laï Abolorè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Bachachath Laï Abolorè sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA 3. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The group ADJENIYA 3 consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative is Bachachath Laï Abolorè, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Bachachath Laï Abolorè is married to a man named Bassitou. The couple have five children who have all attended school. Bachachath Laï Abolorè lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together.  

Bachachath Laï Abolorè attended primary school. For nearly ten years, she has been selling various products (sachets, soaps, etc.) locally. She is passionate about her activity, which allows her to support herself and her children. She buys her stock at a market in Benin.   

To achieve customer satisfaction, Bachachath Laï Abolorè is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group ADJENIYA 3. This credit will help them to meet customer demand and to bolster their profits.

loans.use: to buy various products (sachets, soaps, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Dorokasi

texts.en: Dorokasi is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for five years and also sells goats as additional income. She began business due to her desire to have a better future for her and her children. Like most good mothers she has dreams of educating her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification and setting up sustainable income generating activities such as housing estates and tree planting. Dorokasi intends to use the loan facility to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Sessi 1 Group

texts.fr: SESSI 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier et s’approvisionnant au même endroit. La représentante du groupe, Bodouni Tatiana dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans. Bodouni Tatiana est mariée à un certain Abel. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Bodouni Tatiana n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Bodouni Tatiana mène comme activité la vente de riz, des glacières et divers produits dans un quartier du Bénin. Bodouni Tatiana exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Bodouni Tatiana s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Bodouni Tatiana sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe SESSI 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Sessi 1 is a group with three members, who all live in the same neighborhood and get their supplies in the same place. The group’s representative is called Bodouni Tatiana, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years of age, and is married to Abel. The couple has two children, both at school and under their care, and the family lives together. The couple makes sure that the various household expenses are covered. 

Bodouni Tatiana did not go to school, and for almost 15 years has worked selling rice, cool boxes and miscellaneous products in a neighborhood in Benin. She is passionate about her business, which allows her to provide for herself. Bodouni Tatiana gets her supplies from a market in Benin, and in order to ensure customer satisfaction, she has asked for her first loan along with the other members of the Sessi 1 group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ needs, as well as to generate more profits.

loans.use: To buy rice, cool boxes and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en: Merina is a 32-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling fish for four years; she moves to different markets to sell her fish. She also sells charcoal for additional income. Her personal goal is to educate children up to the university level and build a permanent house for residence, while her business goal is to expand the business to other markets and buy a refrigerator since she has a challenge of poor preserving equipment. Merina is requesting a loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Sumara

texts.en: Ms Sumara is 28 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has been in business of animal sales for the past three years. Being a housewife, she never hesitated to run her own business side-by-side. She thought of utilizing her free time for some productive use, so she purchased a kid goat three years ago as it was easy and cheap to manage. After a year she gained a reasonable amount of profit by its sale which she used to purchase more goats. Currently she has three kid goats and needs to purchase more goats to sell in the coming year. For this she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 for purchasing more goats for resale. She wishes to utilize the earned profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase more kid goats.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida tiene  49 años de edad, soltera, de oficio comerciante, madre de 5 hijos entre las edades de  12, 21, 26, 29 y 33 años de edad. Ella cuenta que comenzó  con una pequeña  pulpería en su casa, pero la tuvo que cerrar por problema  de salud, luego decidió abrir otro negocio con un capital propio, el cual es  un puesto de comida. Inicio a la edad de 43 años con su negocio de comida, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su hija. Cándida le gustaría dar a conocer  sus productos en todo el mercado, Cándida dice que  se encuentra  satisfecha  con su venta de comida ya que es un negocio rentable y le genera  ingresos diarios.
Requiere el crédito para comprar  leña, maíz, maseca, carne, repollo frijoles, aceite y arroz etc. Toda la materia prima que se necesite para elaborar la comida, ella dice que el préstamo le será de mucha ayuda, pues podrá invertir, incrementara en su producción y podrá tener mejores ingresos para su familia, sus planes futuros es acondicionar su casa, exhibir sus productos  y tener mas clientes fijos, pues su deseo es llegar a ser una de las mejores comerciante en la zona, con el objetivo de  mejorar sus ganancias y darles una mejor  educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cándida, 49, is single, a merchant, and the mother of five children ages 12, 21, 26, 29, and 33. She says she began with a small grocery store in her house, which she had to close for health reasons, and then decided to open a food stand with her own funds. She began this food business when she was 43 with her son´s help. Cándida would like her food to be known throughout the market. She is satisfied with her sales, since the business generates daily income and is profitable.

She needs the loan to buy wood, corn, corn flour, meat, cabbage, beans, oil, rice, and all the raw materials she needs to prepare the food. The loan will bring her much needed help, letting her invest, increase her production, and earn more income for her family.

She plans to air condition her house, showcase her food, and attract more steady customers. She wants to be one of the area´s best merchants so that she can increase her profits and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy wood, corn, corn flour, meat, cabbage, beans, oil, rice, and more.

loans.name: Muwanguzi

texts.en:
Muwanguzi lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced with four children and two of them attend school. She is not looking after her siblings.

Muwanguzi has been selling green bananas from her home at retail for nine months, working six days a week. She also sells snacks as an additional source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to stock more bunches of green bananas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to expand her business and accumulate profits so as to start selling by wholesale only. She joined MCDT because loans are accessible and at low interest. She stays in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo de 12 años de edad en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola y comercial situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, verduras y carnes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí, ella y su hijo atienden a sus principales clientes, brindándoles siempre un trato amable y esmerado. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su consorte con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Vilma se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su bodega y aumentar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y ella agradece de antemano el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Vilma, 48, is a mother who lives with her husband and 12-year-old son in Cayaltí district, an agricultural and commercial area located about an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells basic items, groceries, vegetables, and meats from a small store in her house. Here she and her son wait attentively and politely on their customers. The business helps her to contribute with her husband to supporting the family.

Vilma is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to buy more stock for her store and increase her sales. This is her first loan cycle with Kiva, and she thanks the institution in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy basic items, groceries, vegetables, and meats to stock her store.

loans.name: Rahnaz

texts.en:
Ms Rahnaz is a 20-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband. They have two buffaloes to make milk and they sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with the butter and cheese that they make from it. Rahnaz looks after the buffaloes, washes them, and performs the task of collecting milk while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

Ms Rahnaz and her husband have two children. They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and education. In order to make good profits, they have requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. They hope to increase their production capacity, which will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Con 25 años Liliana una mujer muy responsable e impulsadora lleva una vida de pareja con Jimy cuyo fruto de amor son sus pequeños Jim de 5 años y Jhosua de 11 meses. Ambos muy trabajadores tienen muchos sueños, uno de ellos el de construir en adelante su casa a base de material  noble, por el momento ocupan una vivienda construida con adobe. Tomando la decisión de unir fuerzas para progresar le propuso a Jimy quien se desempeña desde hace ya muchos años como mecánico el de hacer realidad un negocio el cual consistía en la venta de repuestos y reparación de vehículos. Fue así que uniendo esfuerzos logra tomar la dirección del negocio desde hace 2 años, de esta manera iniciaron como equipo logrando con el tiempo consolidarlo debido al crecimiento del parque automotor en la zona y a su pareja quien es buen referente en el rubro. Tiene la plena seguridad de que el negocio seguirá creciendo para con el tiempo expandirlo de tal forma que le permita construir su vivienda en la cual tiene planeado abrir una sucursal.
La clave en estos momentos es mantener su negocio bien abastecido y con todo lo necesario para que Jimy pueda desempeñar su trabajar como siempre lo hizo. Comprometida con su cuarto crédito afirma que la puntualidad de sus pagos le ayudó a conseguir que MFP confíe aun mas en ella, comenta también que le agrada trabajar con sus compañeros de su banco comunal pues son personas muy optimistas y organizadas por su manera de trabajar.
Con los 4,000 soles realizará la compra de repuestos para vehículos al por mayor así como algunas herramientas de uso exclusivo en reparación de vehículos.
texts.en:
Liliana is 25 years old. She is a responsible and driven woman who lives with her partner, Jimy, and their two sons Jim (5 years old) and Jhosua (11 months old).  Liliana and Jimy are a hardworking couple with dreams of building their own house out of good material. At the moment, they live in a house made of adobe. 

Two years ago, Liliana made a business proposal to Jimy, who has worked as a mechanic for many years, that the couple work together to start a business selling spare parts and doing auto repairs. So the couple decided to start their business as a team. Since then, they have united their services and been successful, thanks to the growth in the number of cars in their area as well as the good references Jimy carried with him into this business. Liliana is confident that their business will continue growing and with time, will expand in a way that will allow them to build their house and open a branch there. The key in this moment is for Liliana to keep her store well-stocked with all of the equipment necessary for Jimy to continue doing repairs. 

This is Liliana's fourth loan with MFP. Because of her punctuality, she has earned the bank's trust as a borrower. Liliana is very grateful to the other members of her community bank because they are very optimistic and organized workers. With the 4,000 soles from this loan, Liliana will buy spare auto parts at wholesale as well as some tools to use for vehicle repairs in her business.

loans.use: comprar repuestos y herramientas

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who attends school. She is also looking after her mother and siblings. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent.

She has been selling snacks in the market for six months, working six days a week. She has no other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy stock ingredients like cooking oil, Irish potatoes, wheat and maize flour and spices. Her challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of cooking oil. 

Her dream is to expand her business and accumulate profits to buy land and also to own a fully stocked bakery. She joined MCDT because she wanted more capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, wheat, maize flour, Irish potaoes and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as rice, sugar, cassava flour, cooking oil, salt, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Saron Group

texts.en:
Khuolneichawi, with her hand raised, is a member of the Saron Group. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband and five children (three daughters and two sons) in a rented house. Her husband is engaged in a timber business in small holdings. In order to supplement the family income and before the group came into existence, she did weaving and sold vegetables. Having to take care of the children in addition to the household chores, she found it difficult to continue her weaving and selling vegetables activities.

With her first loan and support from her family members, she partitioned and extended their sitting room into a tea hotel. With good faith, she asked her landlord to allow her to construct a fireplace, which is required for a tea stall. Improving steadily in due course, her tea stall has become a common place to entertain for the young and old. She serves tea, puri and a variety of traditional items with many delicacies made from rice grain.
 
She wants a nursing career for her daughters and she wants the boys to choose the military as their career. She plans to enroll her eldest daughter who is now 20 years old, in a reputable nursing school. She also longs to have a home of her own and she, along with her husband, needs to save for a couple of years more to buy a housing plot and build a house.   
   
She is requesting another loan to renovate her tea stall. She plans to use the loan to stock milk powder, sugar and tea leaves and spend the remainder to increase her stock of charcoal and firewood, both used for cooking purposes.

In 2010, she joined the group of five like- minded tribal women from Churachanpur, in the state of Manipur, which is in the northeastern part of India and called the group SARON. They guide and help one another to empower themselves undertaking different means of generating incomes.
Likewise, the rest of the group members are making steady improvement. They need another loan to increase their inventory as the festival season is approaching. The group members' activities include trading livestock to the butcher, selling beetle nut leaves and selling garments to wear.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her tea stall, such as milk powder, sugar, tea leaves, charcoal and firewood for cooking purposes.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de ser amable y cordial. Convive con  Richard y juntos tienen 3 hijos. Actualmente habitan en su propia casa a base de material noble. 
La actividad que realiza Isabel, es la venta de zapatos y ropa de damas y caballeros, para ello debe viajar periodicamente a la ciudad de Lima, para conseguir dichas prendas a un menor costo. Este trabajo lo viene ejeciendo hace 6 años, y sola debe buscar y ganarse clientela. Considera rentable su negocio por las ganancias que le deja, asimismo eso le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija. 
Antes tenia problemas económicos, pues los ingresos de su pareja no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos sus gastos familiares de alimentación, vestir y otros. Ahora desea ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer, abriendo una boutique en su casa para la venta de ropa masculina y femenina. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual en el pago de sus cuotas así como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, asimismo se siente cómoda perteneciendo a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropa y zapatos de diversos modelos y tallas buscando los precios más bajos para que pueda tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel, 36, is responsible and hardworking, as well as kind and cordial. She lives with Richard, and they have three children. They live in their own, well-built home. Isabel sells shoes and men´s and women´s clothing. She must travel regularly to Lima to purchase the clothing at a discount. This has been her business for six years, and she alone is responsible for finding and winning over her clientele. The business is profitable, and it helps her pay household expenses and educate her daughter. 
 
Earlier, she had financial problems because her partner´s income didn´t cover the family´s costs of food, clothing, and other items. She now wants to expand and grow her business by opening a boutique of men´s and women´s clothing in her house. This is her fourth loan cycle with MFP. It eases her mind to know she has financial backing that guarantees that she can keep working. For her part, she promises to continue being a member who makes her payments on time, as she has done in the past. She is comfortable with the members of her communal bank because they are responsible and caring.

She will use the loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy a variety of styles and sizes of clothing and shoes at the best prices so that she can achieve higher profits.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy staple foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Mtvarisa

texts.en:
Mtvarisa is 65 years old, from the small village of Khobi. She has a large family: her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (17 and 18 years old). Mtvarisa and her husband have pensions. 

The income of the family comes from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Mtvarisa sells cheese locally in an open market at a good price. She owns 1.2 hectares of land, where maize and 200 nut-trees are grown. She sells the harvested maize and nuts locally. Each member of the family works hard to insure a good harvest. 

Mtvarisa has requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will be able to increase cheese production. It will significantly increase the income of the family, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Mtvarisa awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been selling kids clothes for seven years. In 2011, she opened her own shop to help her husband in increasing their income and covering her family's expenses.

Siham is a hard worker, with a very good reputation. She is well known in the region for the best prices and the quality of the products she sells.

Siham has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles. Her previous loan helped her a lot in starting up and supporting her business.

Today she is applying for another loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy a new autumn/winter collection to respond to customers needs and increase her capital.

Siham is working hard to expand her business to make sure she will stay capable of supporting her family in everything they might need.

loans.use: To buy a new autumn/winter collection of children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Casada e sem filhos ainda, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É comerciante e vende produtos diversos.Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, farinha, bolachas, sabão, ovos, frangos congelados e outros) para aumentar a capacidade do seu negocio.

No futuro deseja aumentar ainda mais o volume do seu negocio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é vencer a concorrência e elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
She's married and doesn't have children yet. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's in retail and sells various products. With this loan she intends to purchase merchandise (cooking oil, flour, crackers, soap, eggs, frozen chicken, etc.) in order to stock up her business.
In the future she wishes to increase her sales volume even more. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so that she can apply for more loans with Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is beating the competition and the rise in living costs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (cooking oil, flour, crackers, soap, eggs, frozen chicken, etc.).

loans.name: Noudjihou Group

texts.fr: NOUDJIHOU est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Romaine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Romaine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Romaine vend des volailles dans un marché du Bénin. Romaine s’approvisionne dans des régions du Benin. C’est la quatrième fois que, Romaine et les autres membres du groupe NOUDJIHOU sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Noudjihou is a group with four members, who all live in the same village. The group’s representative is called Romaine, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years of age, and is married to Didier. The couple has four children, some of whom are at school and all under their care. Romaine lives with her children and husband, and together the couple makes sure that the various household expenses are provided for. 

For almost 15 years Romaine has worked selling poultry in a market in Benin, and she gets her supplies in the Benin regions. This is the fourth time that she and the other members of the Noudjihou group have requested financial support from Alidé. They have done so to increase their working capital, as well as to better meet their customers’ requests. They have successfully repaid their prior loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry products (eggs, chickens) and rabbits.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Ms Noreen is a 27-year-old married lady. She is very talented and excels in the work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She teaches stitching to poor girls free of cost and also gives them lunch freely. She encourages more females and girls to assist her in her business. She has no children but she is living with her husband and in-laws, including her father-in-law, mother-in-law, and sister-in-law, in her home. 

Her husband sold secondhand mobile phones at a counter in market. His income is not enough to cover the family's expenditures. Noreen started her business to support her family by using her talent and contributing to the family income. Noreen requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, buttons, zips, etc. to meet the increasing demand. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving good and quality food to her family members and a dowry to her sister-in-law through all her hard slog in her business.

loans.use: To buy stock of threads in different colors, buttons, zips, etc. to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Saving Life Group

texts.en:
In 2010, five like- minded tribal women from Sirou village in the state of Manipur in the northeastern part of India came together to form a group called Saving Life. They guide and help one another to empower themselves in their businesses and help improve their lives. Hence, the “saving life” concept was born. 

The one with her hand raised is Zaniang and she is the group leader. She is 43 years old and a mother of two daughters and one son. She lives in a rented room with her two children. In 2007, her husband was electrocuted and died. Since then, she has looked after her children alone and shouldered the responsibility of marrying off her eldest daughter and providing an education for the younger siblings. Her main source of income comes from working as a quarry worker. It takes at least five days to quarry sand to sell from the river bed. Life was not very easy for her until she and her friends came together to help one another
.
With experience from her quarry work and her first loan of INR 5,000, she began to supply sand to contractors undertaking construction work. This was the turning point in her life. In due course, she became known to contractors of varying grades. Apart from the sand, she also supply bricks and cement as required and demanded. She is very happy that her children are attending school and hopes that they will get a white color job for their career. She also plans and wishes that someday soon she will have a house of her own.

Now she needs another loan to construct a small godown (warehouse) to stock cement. She will use the loan to buy building materials such as tin sheets, planks, nails, and waterproof wallpaper and to pay labor charges. Having said this, she plans to stock and sell cement at all times. She believes that she will do well in her business because of the good will that she already earned among the builders in and around town.

Likewise, the rest of the members are also working very hard to supplement their respective family incomes. With the festival season looming ahead, they need another loan to supplement their stock in their garment sales and charcoal businesses.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as tin sheets, planks, nails, and water proof wall paper and to pay labor charges.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Ms. Rani is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last one year with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Rani’s husband. She offers various daily use goods. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list. Her husband is a laborer and also helps his wife in buying stock of goods from the market. 

Rani is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 10,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently in peak season. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 34 years old and married. She lives with her husband in the urban area of Tiribe.

She has a a stall where she sells cereals and other home products. Her business supplies the people at the market and the local residents with their basic goods, so she always has a stable customer base. The income she obtains from her business allows her to help her husband provide for their household.

Kadzo is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which will allow her to continue purchasing products like dry maize, utensils, polythene bags, etc. to maintain her business. She also wants to make improvements to her store. She wants to thank in advance all of the people who are helping her achieve this goal through Kiva.

loans.use: purchasing products like dry maize, utensils, polythene bags, etc.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомджону 24 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он делает все необходимое. С ранних лет он начал работать, так как условия жизни у них были очень тяжелые. Он работал на стройке разнорабочим и таким образом зарабатывал на жизнь и 2 года назад он начал свой бизнес услугой таксиста.  Илхомджон и его семья живут в очень трудных жилищных условиях, поэтому он уже несколько лет накапливает деньги для покупки квартиры, но данное время ему не хватает 2500 сомони. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  2500 сомони для покупки квартиры. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем для покупки квартиры.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon is 24 years old. He is married and raising two children. He does all he can to provide for his family. He started working early on, facing many hardships. He  used to earn a living as an unskilled construction worker. Two years ago he launched his own business providing taxi services.
Ilhomjon and his family have very poor living conditions, which is why he has been saving for the purchase of an apartment, but he is still 2500 TJS short. 
He is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 TJS to buy an apartment. He is counting on your kindness. Let’s help him to buy an apartment.

loans.use: to buy a flat (apartment).

loans.name: Lize

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos que ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É comerciante tem um negocio de criação e venda de frangos de corte. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração e vacina para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação.

No futuro deseja melhorar as sua capoeiras e concluir com a construção da sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é poder conseguir fundos suficientes para poder realizar seus projectos futuros.
texts.en:
She's married and has three children who still attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's in retail and owns a business raising and selling broiler chickens. With this loan she intends to purchase chicks, feed and vaccines in order to increase the number of animals for breeding.
In the future she wishes to improve her chicken hutches and finish the construction of her house. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so that she can apply for more loans with Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is saving enough funds in order to accomplish her projects for the future.

loans.use: to raise broiler chickens.

loans.name: Sumara

texts.en: Ms. Sumara is a 36-year-old married mother of one who faced a difficult time after her husband‘s failure in business. She then decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Seven years ago, Sumara started clothes trading. She always has a great collection of formal dresses to offer to her customers. She knows the choice and taste of her customers very well. However, due to lack of financial resources she was unable to meet customers' demand and so contacted the Kashf foundation at the suggestion of her friend. Now in association with Kashf for six years, Sumara has requested a loan of PKR 20,000. This amount will help her to buy more variety of clothes in various colors and designs by considering the demands of her customers. This will increase her sales and will ultimately help in bringing more cash at home. She desires to provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy more variety of clothes in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda has been operating a retail shop for several years, selling a variety of basic products. Thanks to her determination, she was able to save and start a new business. Recently, she has selling food through a cafe. She sells breakfasts, lunches, dinners, and soft drinks. She plans to use the new loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, food flavors, etc.

She is happy with the profits that her food business generates for her. She hopes to continue growing until she converts her business into a well-known restaurant in her town.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, food flavors, etc.

loans.name: Gnonnou Vankan Group

texts.fr: GNONNOU VANKAN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du  groupe, Georgette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Emmanuel. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Georgette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Georgette exerce la couture à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Georgette vend des tissus, des sachets et des articles de mercerie. Georgette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Georgette et les autres membres du groupe GNONNOU VANKAN sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: GNONNOU VANKAN has three members who live in the same neighborhood. The leader of the group, Georgette (with her hand raised in the photo), is 33 years old and married to a man named Emmanuel. The couple has three children who are all in school and in their care. Georgette lives together with her husband and her children. She and her husband are responsible for all the household expenses. For about 15 years, she has been a dressmaker and worked from her home. As a side business, she also sells fabric and notions. Georgette buys her inventory at a market in Benin.  This is the third loan requested by Georgette and her group GNONNOU VANKAN from ALIDE in order to strengthen their working capital and better respond to their customer's needs. The previous two loans were properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and notions for resale.

loans.name: Franklin  Marcelo

texts.es:
