Franklin es un hombre de 34 años, estudió la escuela primaria y vive con su pareja Vilma de 30 años, tienen una hija, Kamila de 4 años. Juntos viven en una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Quito capital de la provincia del Ecuador, su nombre es Nanegalito, parroquia ubicada al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, que fue residencia de una cultura ecuatoriana. Es un lugar poseedor de diversidad de flora y fauna y además ríos y cascadas que son una fuente cristalina que atrae turistas nacionales y extranjeros, por lo que sus habitantes aprovechan la oportunidad para ofrecer tours, servicio de hospedaje, alimentación, deportes naturales como cabalgatas, etc. Otro medio de producción de la zona es la ganadería con la producción de leche y carne y también la agricultura con la producción de caña de azúcar, yuca, caña, maíz, naranjas, mandarinas y papayas. Las artesanías elaboradas a mano también son una oportunidad de negocio en el lugar, que son demandadas por el uso particular de materiales naturales como semillas del bosque. Por todo esto las autoridades locales se han preocupado por hacer instalaciones adecuadas para que todos sus más de 3000 habitantes tengan acceso a los servicios básicos. Aunque fue una zona que en el pasado no fue muy tomada en cuenta, ahora el trabajo arduo de sus habitantes ha hecho que inversionistas y comerciantes pongan toda su atención en este lugar. 
Franklin aprendió desde niño a criar animales, sus padres le enseñaron con su experiencia y Franklin incursionó en este negocio desde hace 10 años, el cuida a los animales y su hábitat para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. En el transcurso de cada día Franklin dedica 10 horas a su negocio, otras veces más, pero lo importante es que en estos años de experiencia ha podido sustentar a su familia y también aprender más para poder enfrentar la competencia. Ahora ha decidido dar un gran paso de incrementar su negocio, para lo cual ha recurrido a Fundación Alternativa para que a través de Kiva le puedan otorgar un préstamo con el que pueda comprar más animales e insumos para el cuidado de éstos. El incremento en ingresos ayudará a que Franklin pueda darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Franklin is a 34 year old man, he studied through elementary school. He lives with his wife, with whom he has one daughter, Kamila, who is 4 years old. They live together in a rural parish of the city of Quito, the capital province of Ecuador. The parish is called Nanegalito, and is located north-west of the province of Pichincha, which was once home to an indigenous Ecuadorian culture. It is a place full of diverse flora and fauna, and also has rivers and waterfalls, which are sources of crystal clear water, that attract national and foreign tourists alike. For this reason the locals make the most of the opportunity by offering tours, home stays, meals, natural sports like horseback riding, etc. Another source of income generation for the area is livestock, with the production of milk and meat, as well as agriculture with the production of sugar cane, yucca, bamboo, corn, oranges, mandarins and papayas. Artisan work done by hand is also an opportunity for business in this area, in particular things made with natural products, like seeds found in the forest, are in demand.     

The local authorities have been concerned with providing adequate facilities for the more than 3,000 people who live here, to be able to have access to basic services. Even though in the past it was an area that was not paid much attention to, now the hard work that the community members have put in has attracted the interest of investors and business people.

Franklin began learning how to take care of animals when he was a child. His parents taught him with their own experience, and Franklin has been involved in this type of business since he was 10 years old. He takes care of animals and their living space so that he can later sell them in the local market. Each day Franklin dedicates 10 hours to his business, and sometimes more. The most important thing is that during these years he has been able to support his family and he has also been able to continue learning which has allowed him to keep up with the competition. Now he has decided to take a big step in increasing his business, which is why he has turned to Fundación Alternativa, so that through Kiva they can grant him a loan, with which he will be able to buy more animals and supplies to be able to take care of them. The increase in income will help Franklin be able to give to his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle and supplies for breeding.

loans.name: Sousa

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de uma filha que já tem o seu próprio lar , vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Tem um negocio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, massas, peixe, arroz, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro deseja melhorar ainda mais o seu negocio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é manter-se saudável para poder garantir a efectividade dos seus planos.
texts.en:
He's married and has a daughter who has a household of her own. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He owns a business selling various products. With this loan he intends to purchase goods (flour, noodles, fish, rice, cooking oil, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise.
In the future he wishes to improve his business even more. For that reason he pledges to repay this loan as scheduled, so he can apply for more loans with Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is keeping his health in check so that he can ensure the efectiveness of his plans.

loans.use: to purchase goods (flour, noodles, fish, rice, cooking oil, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise.

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Possui um negocio próprio de venda de roupas diversas usadas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negocio e melhorar as condições de habitação da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é enpenhar-se cada vez mais no seu trabalho para conseguir aumentar a sua renda.
texts.en:
She's single and has three children who attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She owns her own business selling various types of used clothing. With the current loan she intends to purchase bundles of clothing in order to stock up with merchandise.
In the future she wishes to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. For that reason she pledges to repay this loan as scheduled, so she can apply for more loans with Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working increasingly harder so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for selling.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is from the Chkhorotsku district of West Georgia. She is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children (12, 16, and 18 years old). Her husband works as an artisan locally and gets a monthly income. The children go to the village school. Marina runs the agricultural business. In particular, she has a small dairy farm of two calves and two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides this, the family owns an agricultural land where nuts and maize are grown. Marina does all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. In addition, she is successfully involved in the animal husbandry business and has four horses and two pigs. She sells the cheese products, piglets, nuts, and maize at the local open market. Marina and her husband work hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions for their family.
	
She requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. After the number of cattle of is increased, Marina will receive more milk for her dairy and sell more cheese. This will significantly increase the family income and Marina will renovate her house to improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Meline

texts.en: Meline lives in Geghi village of Syuniq region with her husband and two children: her 8-year-old son and 7-year-old daughter. Meline and her husband are involved in agriculture. They keep cows, pigs, and chickens and work hard to support their family. Meline has applied for this loan in order to increase the livestock by purchasing two bulls and buying forage to feed them. As the family’s main income comes from agriculture, this loan will significantly help Meline to earn more and insure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls and forage to feed them

loans.name: Catine

texts.pt:
Solteiro e pai 1 filho menor de idade, vive na casa dos pais com seu filho e namorada e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele.

É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, óleo, açúcar, sabão, caldos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade e diversidade da sua mercadoria e responder a demanda da sua clientela.

No futuro deseja melhorar as condições de habitação da sua família e adquirir uma viatura para fins comerciais, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é adquirir fundos suficientes para atingir seus objectivos.
texts.en:
He's single and has an underage son. He lives with his son in his parents' house and support his parents.
He's in retail and sells various foodstuffs. With this loan he intends to purchase goods (flour, cooking oil, sugar, soap, broths, etc.) in order to stock up and diversify his merchandise, so that he can meet his customers' orders.
In the future he wishes to improve his family's living conditions and to acquire a vehicle for his business. For that reason he pledges to repay this loan as scheduled, so he can apply for more loans with Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is saving enough funds for achieving his goals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (flour, cooking oil, sugar, soap, broths, etc.).

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La Sra. Josefa es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 61 años, está casada con el Sr. Benjamín de 65 años. Tienen 3 hijos todos mayores de edad que trabajan de forma independiente.
Josefa tiene una despensa en su casa particular, y ya tiene una clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales. Ella es una  señora muy trabajadora, excelente cliente. Además se dedica en la producción y venta de tomate, que también vende en su despensa.
Solicita del crédito para poder surtir su despensa, con leche, panificados, verduras, frutas y demás.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa is from the city of Santaní. She is 61 years old and married to Sr. Benjamin, age 65. All three of their children are adults who work independently.

Josefa has a food pantry in her home and has built up an established clientele. She is able to generate a good income and has good business and personal references. Josefa is a hardworking woman and an excellent client. She also grows and sells tomatoes, which are offered in her shop.

Josefa is requesting a loan so that she can restock her food pantry with milk, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products.

loans.use: to buy milk, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is from Senaki district of West Georgia. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband. Both family members are provided with a retirement pension. The family runs their agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm of 5 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides that, Lamara owns a vineyard and agricultural land where nuts and maize are grown. The family does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. Lamara picks the grapes in her vineyard and produces wine and vodka. In addition, the family has a pig. They sell the cheese products, wine, vodka, piglets, nuts and maize at the local open market. Lamara and her husband work hard to put aside some savings and improve living conditions for their family.

Lamara requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. After the number of cattle will be increased, Lamara will receive more milk for her dairy and sell more cheese. This will significantly increase the family income and Lamara will be able to renovate her house to improve living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of gas bottles

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is still running a clothes trading business in the rented place. Thanks to his business’ income, Vahe is able to keep his family. Also, he bought furniture and home appliances for his apartment. 

Vahe used his previous Kiva loan to buy an assortment of clothes to resell. Now he is seeking $3,000 to buy a lot of winter clothes: sweaters, blouses, jackets and trousers for his business before New Year’s holidays, when the trading is very active.

loans.use: to buy a lot of winter clothes: sweaters, blouses, jackets and trousers for his business.

loans.name: Fifame Group

texts.fr: FIFAME est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Adèle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Daniel. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Adèle a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Adèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a une dizaine d’années que Adèle exerce comme activité, la couture dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adèle vend des articles de mercerie. Adèle exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Adèle sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe FIFAME. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: FIFAME has three members who all live in the same neighborhood. The leader of the group, Adèle (with her hand raised in the photo), is 34 years old and married to a man named Daniel. The couple has three children, some attend school now and all are in their care. Adèle completed elementary and intermediate school. She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband are responsible for all the household expenses. For about the past 12 years, Adele has been a dressmaker in her workshop. As a side business, she also sells notions. She is passionate about her work which allows her to provide for her children. In an effort to meet her client's needs and to increase her working capital, Adèle is requesting a third loan from ALIDE along with the other members of her group. The loan will help her to better respond to her client's needs and increase her profits. The two previous loans were both properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase notions for resale.

loans.name: Chipitu

texts.en: Chipitu is 35 years old, married, and has five children. In order to support his family, he became involved in selling basic home products. When he was first starting his business, he had very little money. Then, he requested his first loan from Yehu. He has been operating a retail shop for the last two years. He always relies on his strength and plans to expand his business and own a wholesale. Today, Chipitu needs a loan in the sum of 50,000 KES to purchase merchandise like basic grains, soft drinks, food stuffs, etc., and he hopes very much that you would support him in his business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like basic grains, soft drinks, food stuffs, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 58 years of age and is married to Charles. They have two children and they live in Nyahururu town. She sells cereals and has been in the business for 10 years now.

This is her second loan and she plans to buy dry maize and beans to sell in her business. This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers as well as make more profits which she'll use to provide for the needs of her family.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to invest more in her business by selling cereals to schools and other markets.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is now 26 years old, still having her two children aged now six and three years old. With her previous loans she has improved on her dairy farm and now she earns an income of 20,000 monthly.  

She is now servicing her third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD after she repaid the previous loans successfully and intends to purchase more heifers for her expanded dairy farm.  


The profits will be used to repay the loan and plough some back to her dairy farm. She hopes for a bright future.

loans.use: purchase heifers

loans.name: Mwachidudu

texts.en:
Mwachidudu, 52, is married and has eight children who are dependent on him. He lives in his own house with his family. His house is located in one of the settlements in the coastal zone.

Mwachidudu has operated a home-based business, selling animals, for over ten years. He learned the business from his parents and knows it to perfection. Income earned from the business is used to cover family expenses. Mwachidudu has competition but he also has a wide market for his sales. Mwachidudu also earns extra income from tasks related to agriculture. Mwachidudu is asking Kiva, through Yehu, for a 30,000 KES loan to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Joanete

texts.pt:
Casada mãe de 3 filhos, 2 dos quais já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, arroz, feijão, açúcar, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria e satisfazer o consumidor.

No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negocio e aumentar o seu rendimento mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é a subida de preços dos produtos no mercado Grossista.
texts.en:
She's married and has three children, two of whom are already adults. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's in retail and sells various foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (peanuts, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise and keep her customers satisfied.
In the future she wishes to expand her business and increase her income. For that reason she pledges to repay this loan as scheduled, so she can apply for more loans with Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is the rise in the prices of products at the wholesale market.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (peanuts, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc.).

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is the mother of two daughters. She lives in Shaki village of Syunik region with her husband, two daughters, father-in-law and mother-in-law. The main income of the family comes from agriculture. They keep pigs, cows, and chickens. They also cultivate wheat and grow apple trees. Mariam has applied for this loan in order to increase the number of livestock, as well as to buy grass and wheat seeds. She plans to hire workers to make the cultivation as well as purchase fuel for the agricultural technique. This loan will also help Mariam to cover these costs. Mariam hopes that with the help of the loan the sales of wheat will grow and she will be able to cover the basic needs of her family and ensure the future of her two daughters.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fuel, grass and to hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
El comité “Manantial" tiene como objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa y por medio de esto ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Leandra es la presidenta del grupo, ella tiene un pequeño negocio frente a su casa, donde tiene todo tipo de productos y donde ella atiende amablemente a los vecinos del barrio, también hace masas y vende en su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, harina, huevo, aceite y demás. Todas las miembros se esfuerzan por salir adelante e ir mejorando.
texts.en:
The committee named “Manantial” (Spring) has set a goal for each of its members: to work in a spirit of cooperation so that they can reach the highest level of the program. This goal has enabled them to help their families.

Sra. Leandra is the group president. She has a small business located at the front of her house where she sells all types of products. Leandra attends to her neighbors from the area in a friendly manner. She also makes pastries and sells them in her business. Leandra is requesting a loan so that she can buy beverages, flour, eggs, oil, and other items.

All of the members strive to move forward and keep improving.

loans.use: to buy beverages, flour, eggs, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Djrmahuton Group

texts.fr: DJRMAHUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies s’approvisionnant au même endroit. La représentante du groupe, Afia Gnonnougan (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean. Afia Gnonnougan est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Afia Gnonnougan vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Afia Gnonnougan a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de douze ans que Afia Gnonnougan mène comme activité la vente des fagots de bois et des articles de mercerie à son domicile. Afia Gnonnougan mène cette activité afin de pourvoir aux besoins du ménage. Afia Gnonnougan s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Afia Gnonnougan sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DJRMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: DJRMAHUTON is a group with three members who are friends and all shop in the same area. The leader of the group, Afia Gnonnougan (with her hand raised in the photo), is 42 years old and married to a man named Jean. Afia Gnonnougan has three children who are all in school and in her care. Afia Gnonnougan lives together with her husband and children. Together they are responsible for all the household expenses. She didn't finish much school. It has been almost 12 years since she begun selling firewood and notions from her home in order to pay for all the household expenses. Afia Gnonnougan buys her inventory in Benin. In an effort to satisfy her client's needs, she is requesting her fourth loan along with the other members of her group, DJRMAHUTON. The loan will help her better respond to her client's needs and increase profits. The previous loans were all properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase notions and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y amable, además de ser trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Jorge y actualmente habitan en su casa propia. La actividad que tiene Lilian es la venta de bebidas gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores, asimismo vende comida a la parrilla. Es así que cada fin de semana, en el frontis de su casa, ofrece estos productos. Tiene más de 20 años dedicándose  a éste negocio y por el momento solo cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano, quien atiende a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa. 
Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja. En un inicio tuvo dificultades pues la condición económica de su hogar era precaria, de esa manera le era díficil poder estudiar y entonces buscó un oficio al cual dedicarse y  es así como empezó con éste negocio. Le gusta lo que hace y las ganancias que le deja, además el poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y contar con tiempo disponible para dedicarlos a otras actividades. En un futuro, desea ampliar su negocio, como el vender ropas de damas, caballeros y niños. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable, está muy contenta de continuar con este grupo ya que son muy cumplidos y amables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su negocio con bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y sabores en mayor volumen, comprará también cervezas y otras bebidas.
texts.en:
Lilian, 27 years old, is a happy and friendly woman as well as being hardworking and eager to get ahead. She lives with her partner, Jorge, and currently they have their own house.  

Lilian sells different brands and flavors of soft drinks, as well as grilled food. She offers these products every weekend in front of her house. She has had her business for more than 20 years and at the moment, her only helper is her brother who waits on customers when she is away from the house.

She considers her business profitable because of the income it generates. At the beginning she had problems since the financial condition of her home was precarious and it was difficult for her to continue her studies. Consequently she looked for a job and that was how she started this business. She enjoys what she does and the income she earns as well as being able to be comfortably at home and have time available to do other things. 

In the future she wants to expand her business and sell clothing for men, women and children, as well. This is loan number 2 from MFP. She is very excited and grateful for the financial support they offer her to continue with her plans. She does not want to stop repaying her loan due to a lack of money and that is why she is committed to being very punctual and responsible. She is very happy to continue with her communal bank because the members are very committed and friendly.

With the S/. 1,500 requested, Lilian will purchase merchandise to stock her business such as different brands and flavors of soft drinks wholesale, as well as beer and other drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and complement them with the sale of beer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 42 years old and married with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. Four years ago she decided to trade in clothes after assessing the profitability of the business and her need to live a modest life. Business is usually at its peak during the festive seasons and when children are in holidays and she is very keen to satisfy the tastes and preferences of her different customers. 

Florence’s dream is to expand her business to new markets and educate her children up to the university. She intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, a 37-year-old mother of two children and married to David, is a farmer in Nyahururu town. She plants cash crops such as maize and beans as well as doing poultry keeping. She has been in the farming and poultry business for three years.

This is her second loan and she plans to use the amount to buy  more chicks to rear which she will later sell at a profit. She will also sell the eggs to various shop traders in the area. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

Nancy hopes to grow her farming and poultry businesses, make more income, and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more collections of toys such as cars, games, doll houses and kitchen sets, etc.

loans.name: Iris Yaneth

texts.es: Iris, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella es muy emprendedora anteriormente trabajaba en una repostería como despachadora y con sus ahorros ha logrado establecer su propio negocio en las aceras de uno de los mercados de la ciudad. Allí vende accesorios para telefonos celulares como ser cobertores, baterías, cargadores, y otros, también vende maquillajes como lápiz labial, sombras, esmalte para uñas, corta uñas, polvo compacto y otros. El negocio ha sido rentable ya tiene tres años de tenerlo y obtiene los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de sus hijos. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado de 10,000 lempiras va surtir más su negocio de accesorios para celulares y cosméticos, con el fin de hacer crecer mas el negocio. Su meta a futuro es generar más ingresos para terminar de ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Iris, age 38, is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  She is very enterprising.  She previously worked at a pastry business as a dispatcher.  With her savings she managed to establish her own business on the sidewalk of one of the city markets.

That is where she sells cell phone accessories like cases, batteries, chargers, and others.  She also sells make-up like lipstick, eye shadow, fingernail polish, nail trimmers, compact powder, and others.  The business has been profitable as she has had it for three years.  She gets the income needed to support her children.

With this 10,000 lempira loan that she has requested she will stock her business more with cell phone accessories and cosmetics.  She will do this in order to make her business grow more.  Her goal for the future is to generate more income so that she can finish expanding her house.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories and cosmetics that she will sell.

loans.name: Cerro Verde Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Cerro Verde, se formo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros, y actualmente  el grupo se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta, donde todas se ayudan.
 El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras.
La mayoría de estas mujeres son de campo y reciben esta gran oportunidad de crecimiento, una de ellas es Francisca, quien cría animales de corral y los vende, solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de alimentos para sus animales, y así tener un buen stock de ellos.
texts.en:
The “Cerro Verde” (Green Hill) committee formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members and they are currently in the second cycle working together and helping each other out.  The group began with unity and mutual support among the members who all have economic activities and are very hardworking.

Most of these women are from the countryside and are receiving this great opportunity for growth.  One of them is Francisca who raises barnyard animals to sell.  She’s requesting this loan to buy animal feed to have a good stock of them.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Five Amigos Group

texts.en:
In 2009, these five tribal women came together and formed a group called “Five Amigos”. Having the same economic background, they strive collectively to help one another to have a meaningful life for themselves. They live in Churachanpur in the state of Manipur, which is located in the northeastern part of India.

The one with her hand raised is Mawii, a member of Five Amigos. She is 35 years old and a mother of two daughters who are 13 and 7 years old. The younger daughter is suffering from Downs Syndrome and goes to a school arranged for such challenged ones. In 2006, her husband died in a road accident, leaving her to live a widow's life. Since then, she had been engaged in retailing businesses supplying organic and fresh vegetables and selling used clothes on the weekend. Though she may have had hard luck, she is happy that both her daughters go to school to learn. With a “special needs” daughter to take care of and the bargaining nature of the market, she could never do well with her vegetable retailing business.

So, with her first loan of INR 5,000, she changed her trade to selling army canteen products door to door. Since the products are sanctioned for the army at subsidized rates, the commission rate is higher. She supplies almost any commodity from toiletry products and appliances to consumables. At the initial stage, it took longer to dispose of the stock but now she is not only disposing of her products more quickly. She usually refills her stock two times a month.
    
When asked about her dreams and wishes, she got shy and said, “May my children flourish even if I suffer. I want for them to have a good life”. Her two happy tears in her eyes said it all about her appreciation and gratitude when asked about her feelings for all the people around the world who lend money to help someone like herself.

She is doing very well with her business but she wants to own a clothing store, which will lessen the time she has to move around and enable her to be there for her daughters. She needs another loan to increase her supplies such as soap, lotion for winter, saving cream supplies for the barber shop, milk powder, tea leaves, hair gel, toothpaste and the like. She supplies these items in large quantities to the down town shops. Beside the shops, she has customers whom she supplies at their home according to their needs. 
 
Likewise, the rest of the group members are also working very hard to make the day’s ends meet. Out of five members, four are widows struggling to do their best. The activities of the group members include selling vegetable at the market, selling used clothes and running a tea stall. They requested another loan to grow their business.

loans.use: To buy more soap, lotion, shaving cream milk powder, tea leaves, hair gel, toothpaste, etc to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Encarnación, 11 mujeres se unieron y formaron un grupo para ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas están en su cuarto ciclo y la meta de todas es ir creciendo y ayudando a sus familias.
La Sra. Jorgelina, es parte de este desafío, ella tiene su despensa en su casa, y gracias a la ayuda de su grupo y a su talento para las ventas está creciendo y le va muy bien. Cuenta que está casada con el señor Máximo de profesión albañil, tienen 2 hijos, por quienes el y su marido trabajan arduamente.
Jorgelina solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, verduras y demás productos para poder abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Encarnacion, 11 women got together and formed a group so that they could all help each other.  They are in their 4th loan cycle.  Each of these women wants to grow their business and help their family.

Jorgelina is part of this group.  She has a store in her house, and thanks to the help of this group and her talent for sales, she is growing her business and it's doing very well.  She says that she is married to Maximo, who is a bricklayer, and they have 2 children, for whom she and her husband work arduously.

Jorgelina is requesting a loan to buy drinks, dairy products, vegetables and other products to stock up her store.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Зебунисо 24 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она окончила Педагогический колледж по специальности методиста в 2009 году. Она очень упорно работает в средней школе для того, чтобы помочь родителям для проживания. Зебунисо хочет дополнить свои знания и с такой целью она в этом году поступила в Педагогический Государственный Университет. Данное время она студентка 1 курса заочного отделения. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Зебунисо ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zebuniso is 24 years old, she is married and she lives with her parents.  She graduated from the pedagogical college with a specialization in methodology in 2009.  She worked very hard in high school so she could help her parents.  Zebuniso wants to add to her knowledge and with that goal in mind, she earned a place at the State Pedagogical Institute this year.  At the moment, she is studying part-time as a first-year student.  She is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition.  Zebuniso awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres unidas tiene 13 miembros, donde cada una tiene el objetivo de trabajar duro y ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo. Ellas son luchadoras y quieren esforzarse al máximo y crecer como microempresarias.
Adolfina es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, patos, cabras, ovejas y demás.  Es un trabajo muy duro, pero ella está contenta con lo que hace ya que es un oficio digno y honesto.
Solicita de este crédito para comprar alimentos para sus animales, como ser balanceados, granos y demás.
texts.en: The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee has 13 members each with the objective of working hard to help their families by means of this work.  They are tenacious and want to strive to the maximum to grow as micro businesswomen.  Adolfina is one of the members and she works raising barnyard animals like chickens, ducks, goats, sheep and others.  It’s very hard work but she’s happy with what she does because it’s honest, dignified work.  She’s requesting this loan to buy animal feed, like concentrates, grains and others.

loans.use: to buy feed and grains.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora con muchas ganas de progresar. Convive con Dante y juntos tienen 2 hijos. Actualmente habitan cómodamente  su casa propia.
La actividad que realiza  Mónica es la crianza y venta de pollos, para eso cuenta con un pequeño galpón instalado en la huerta de su casa con una capacidad para 250 pollos. Ya grandes estos animales, son comercializados en los mercados, y otros tanto en su misma casa.  Lleva en éste negocio cerca de 8 años y recibe el apoyo constantes de sus hijos y de su conyugue. 
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones tanto personales como económicas, se siente muy bien porque con ello colabora en la ecuación de sus hijos, afortunadamente ha escogido trabajar con un  producto muy demandado en la región y eso le permite vender muy bien a diario, viendo estos resultados tiene planes de mejorar su local de ventas para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Este es el crédito numero 3 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará  250 pollos bebe para iniciar una nueva campaña de crianza, más alimentos balanceados para su desarrollo y crecimiento adecuando.
texts.en:
Mónica, 43 years old, is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is eager to get ahead. She lives with her partner, Dante, with whom she has two children. Currently they live comfortably in their own house.

Mónica raises and sells chickens. To do so she has a small shed, which has a capacity of 250 chickens, installed in the garden of her house.When they are grown they are sold at the markets and some from her own home. She has had this business for nearly eight years and receives constant support from her children and her spouse.

She enjoys her business since it has brought many satisfactions, personal as well as financial. She feels good about it because it has enabled her to collaborate in paying for her children’s education. Fortunately, she has chosen to work with a product that is in high demand in the region and this enables her to have very good sales every day. In view of her results, she has plans to improve her sales space in order to provide better service.

This is her third loan from MFP and she is grateful to all those who provide the financing that she needs in order to finalize her plans. She is committed to making her payments on time and she hopes to continue working with the communal bank she belongs to for the companionship and solidarity that the members offer one another. With the sum of S/. 2,000 requested she will buy 250 baby chicks to start a new cycle of care as well as more nutritional feed to insure their proper growth and development.

loans.use: to purchase 250 chicks and nutritional feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Chimera

texts.en:
Chimera has been engaged in vegetable selling for four years. He is a 49-year-old married man and has six children. Chimera started his business with very small capital. He has been able to expand and he is now selling a variety of items to the neighborhood.

He wants to increase his business and have more income from it to open his own fruit and vegetable shop. The challenge he faces currently is that he broke his hand and therefore he at times opens his business nursing his hand. Chimera is asking for 25,000 KES to buy various sorts of fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD, La socia continua con su negocio de venta de anticuchos, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia vende anticuchos de corazón y carne siendo este un negocio familiar ya que la socia sigue trabajando con su papa y su hermana, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como carne  y para algunos gastos personales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She’s a member of the “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength and Friendship) communal bank and continues with her business selling ‘anticuchos’ [grilled meat snacks].  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She sells heart and meat anticuchos; it’s a family business because she continues working with her father and sister.  She’s a responsible, dedicated woman who supports her family this way.  She’s requesting the loan to buy ingredients like meat and to pay some personal costs.  She’s grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy meat and to pay some personal costs.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD, él socio continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos como trigo, habas entre otros, él socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, a la vez el socio continua brindando el servicio de taxi en sus tiempos libres, siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: He’s a member of the “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength and Friendship) communal bank and continues with his business selling dry goods like wheat and lima beans, among others.  He’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to daily effort he puts into his business.  He also continues providing taxi service in his free time.  This is how he supports his family.  He’s requesting the loan to buy tires for his car.  He’s grateful for the loan granted and commits to make his scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is 30 years old and from a small village in the Khobi district. She lives with her husband, two children, sister and father. Her father is a watchman and her sister is a baker, and both of them get a monthly income.

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a horse, 2 milk cows and a calf, whose milk is used in cheese production. Asmat sells cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Besides, Asmat owns 1.2 hectares of land where maize is grown. She is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business.

Asmat requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will produce and sell more cheese. It will significantly increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Asmat awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 23-year-old single mother living in Masindi, Uganda. When she became pregnant her parents decided not to pay her school fees and she had to venture into business to support her child. She got the initial capital from a financial institution and the business is very profitable despite challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the high demand.

She has dreams of building a house, educating her child and owning a wholesale shop. Joy is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as matchboxes and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as matchboxes and paraffin to sell

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscilah is 28 years old, married and blessed with four children aged between one and 12 years old. She buys and sells cereals and has been in operation for a period of two years earning a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

She has borrowed a loan of 10,000 KES, this being her second term loan from KADET Ltd., and wishes to use this amount to purchase five bags of dry maize for resale. The profits earned will be used to repay the loan.  

She hopes to grow her business and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more dry maize for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD, La socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa como casacas, polos, chompas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,la socia vende su mercadería en las ferias dominicales en uno de los distritos de Cusco, la socia sale en la foto con su nieta la cual continua criando en la semana siendo esta una forma de continuar apoyando a su hija,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como pantalones para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank "Union, Fuerza y Amistad" ("Unity, Strength and Friendship"). She continues with her business of selling clothes such as jackets, polo-shirts and sweaters amongst others. She has had this business for years and it is going well thanks to her daily hard work. The borrower sells her merchandise at Sunday fairs in one of the districts of Cusco. She appears in the photo with her granddaughter who she continiues to look after during the week as a way of supporting her daughter. The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person and in this way helps her family to get ahead.  

The borrower is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as trousers for her business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as trousers for her business.

loans.name: Dilma

texts.es:
Dilma es separada  tiene 4 hijos mayores todos casados e independientes a ella. Tiene un pequeño local de costura donde confecciona remeras, ropas de niños y ropas deportivas.
Dilma se inicio en la actividad con un dinero  que junto de  otros trabajos anteriores que realizaba como vendedora ambulante, y con la ayuda de su hijo monto para su taller. Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, solicita del crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, ya que tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
Dilma is separated from her husband and has four adult children who are married and do not live with her. She owns a small sewing shop where she makes T-shirts, children's clothing, and sportswear. She started this business with her earnings from a previous job as a traveling salesperson, as well as some start-up help from her son.

Dilma is a responsible person who is eager to excel. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread to complete some orders from her sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
El grupo está conformado por 13 mujeres, el comité se llama Girasol, las señoras se reúnen para poder apoyarse y solucionar cualquier problema que tengan. Son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
Maria es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de pescados, y comenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene mucha venta, porque el pescado esta mas barato. Solicita este crédito para la compra de pescado, y de esa forma poder tener un stock grande de sus productos. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues les será de gran ayuda.
texts.en: This group consists of 13 women; it’s called “Girasol” (Sunflower).  The women meet to help each other out and solve any problem they might have.  They are very hardworking, enterprising people.  María is group president.  She sells fish and comments that she does very well because her sales are good because fish is less expensive.  She’s asking for this loan to buy fish so that she can have a large stock of her product available.  They are grateful for the opportunity they are getting since it will be of great help to them.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from the Chkhorotsku district of West Georgia. She is a widow and lives alone in her house. She works as a teacher at the local school and gets a monthly salary. She is provided with a retirement pension as well.

Liana runs an agricultural business. In particular, she has a small dairy farm of 2 calves and 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides, Liana owns agricultural land where nuts and maize are grown. She does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. In addition, Liana has a pig. She sells the cheese products, piglets, nuts and maize at the local open market. Liana is a very hardworking woman with rich experience in her work.

She requested a credit for expansion of the cattle shed. After the building is expanded, Liana will be able to keep more livestock there. This will enable them to double production and sales of dairy food and the income of the family will significantly increase. With an increased amount of profit, they will be able to repair the house because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to expand the cattle shed

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesus es de la ciudad de Luque, tiene 12 integrantes, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan las unas a las otras por salir adelante. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que trabajan por sus hijos, para darle un futuro sin privaciones.
La Sra. Sara se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas todos los días, lleva a todos los almacenes de la zona, esta casada con el señor Julio y  tiene 2 hijas por quienes ambos luchan incansablemente. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de todos los materiales para su trabajo, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, y demás.Tiene como meta abrir un pequeño copetín en su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called “Divino Niño” (Holy Child) and is from the city of Luque.  It has 12 members; all of them work and help each other move ahead.  They are female heads of household who work to provide their children with a future that’s free of want.

Sara sells fast-food every day.  She takes it to all the local stores.  She’s married to Julio and has two daughters she and her husband strive for tirelessly.  She’s requesting the loan to buy the materials like meat, vegetables, condiments and others she needs for work.  Her goal is to open a small snack bar at home.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and others.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsa es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella y su marido trabajan arduamente para poder seguir dando a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
Elsa es dueña de una despensa bien surtida la ciudad desde hace más de 4 años, se destaca que todos trabajan en forma familiar y les va muy bien. El marido de Elsa, trae productos de posada y distribuye por el barrio en donde ya tiene su clientela fija.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de panificados, verduras, frutas, lácteos y demás insumos para poder seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elsa is from the city of Encarnación.  She’s married and has two children.  She and her husband work hard to be able to continue giving their children everything they need to live a life that’s free from want.  Elsa has owned a well-stocked grocery store in the city for more than four years. She stands out because the entire family works together and they do very well.  Elsa’s husband brings merchandise from Posadas to sell in their neighborhood where they have a regular clientele.  She’s requesting the loan to buy baked goods, vegetables, dairy products and other supplies to continue providing a good variety to her customers..

loans.use: to buy baked goods, vegetables, fruit, dairy products and others.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga tiene 53 años, está casada desde hace mucho tiempo con el señor Luis, tienen  hijos, pero todos ya mayores que la ayudan con los gastos del día a día.
La señora Olga es comerciante desde hace varios años, tiene un local de venta de frutas, verduras y productos de primera necesidad en su casa. Tiene mucha clientela ya que son vendedores mayoristas y distribuyen a comercios más pequeños, vendedores ambulantes y puestos de ventas de la zona. Su esposo le ayuda en esta actividad, el se encarga de distribuir con su vehículo a los clientes que no pueden llegar hasta su local. Se dedican a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, su negocio ha ido creciendo de a poco y actualmente ya tiene buena clientela. 
Solicita de este crédito, para la compra de frutas de estación, para poder surtir y dar buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Olga, 53, has been married to Luis for a long time; they have children but they are all adults now who help out with household expenses.  Olga has been a merchant for many years.  She sells fruit, vegetables and basic staples at home.  She has a large clientele because she’s a wholesaler who supplies smaller stores, street vendors and local stands.  Her husband helps her in this activity.  He’s in charge of making deliveries with his car to customers who are unable to come to her locale.  They’ve been in this business for a long time and it’s been growing little by little and as of now has a good clientele.  She’s requesting this loan to buy seasonal fruit to stock up on and have a good variety available for customers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: FIFA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Assanatou dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans est mariée à un certain Janvier. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Assanatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de douze ans que Assanatou mène comme activité la vente des vivres (maïs, tubercules d’ignames) à son domicile. Assanatou exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Assanatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Assanatou sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
FIFA is a group made up of three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood.

The group's representative, Assanatou, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 44 years old and married to a man named Janvier.  The couple have four children, all in school and their dependents.  Husband and wife live with their children and jointly take care of the various needs of the household.

Assanatou did not attend school.  She has been selling food products (maize, yam tubers) from her home, for almost twelve years.  She has a passion for this activity, which allows her to meet her own needs.  She stocks up at a market located in Benin.

Eager to satisfy her customers' needs, she is requesting a fourth loan, along with the other members of the FIFA group.  

This loan will be used to better meet their customers' expectations and to make more profits.  Their previous loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and yam tubers.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La Sra. Delia es cliente recurrente de Fundación Paraguaya, está casada con la Sr. Antonio hace 30 años, quien trabaja como chofer de una línea de transportes  y viven en la ciudad de Luque.
La Sra. Delia se dedica a una despensa desde el año 1998. Tiene varias operaciones canceladas hasta la fecha y pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, panificados, azúcar, yerba, etc. y de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
Con gran variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes,  le dará un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida y de toda su familia.
texts.en: Delia is a recurrent client of Fundación Paraguaya.  She’s been married to Antonio for 30 years; he works as a driver for a transportation firm and they live in the city of Luque.  Delia has had a grocery store since 1998.  She’s repaid several loans to date and is asking for this one to buy beverages, baked goods, sugar, tea, etc. to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers.  With a great variety of products to offer her customers, she will earn a larger profit margin which will help her improve her and her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, sugar, tea, etc.

loans.name: Mahukpego (Sata) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO (SATA) est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kouassialé Emilie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Kouassialé Emilie est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Jean Marc. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Kouassialé Emilie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses diverses charges, Kouassialé Emilie vend des ustensiles de cuisine et des produits vivriers par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Kouassialé Emilie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Kouassialé Emilie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO (SATA), un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les deux crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MAHUKPEGO (SATA) comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Kouassialé Emilie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 36 years old and married to a tailor named Jean Marc. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. The couple jointly meet the diverse needs of the household. 

Kouassialé Emilie did not attend school. To cope with her diverse expenses, she sells kitchen utensils and staple foods via the distribution system. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her sales and revenues, Kouassialé Emilie is requesting, along with the other members of the group MAHUKPEGO (SATA), a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to boost their business and grow their customer base and their revenues. The two previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and staple foods

loans.name: Mahuena Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUENA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Joulafè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Joulafè est âgée de 55 ans et est une veuve. Joulafè est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Aucun des enfants n’est plus à sa charge. Joulafè vit seule et assure seule ses différents besoins. Pour y arriver, Joulafè vend depuis environs sept ans, des oreillers, des matelas et des balais. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Joulafè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Joulafè sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUENA, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The Mahuena group has three members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Joulafè, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 55 years of age and a widow. She has three children, some of whom are at school. Her children are no longer dependent on her. 

Joulafè lives by herself, and is solely responsible for her different needs. To provide for herself, she has worked for around seven years selling pillows, mattresses and brooms. This business allows her to meet her needs without any great difficulty. Joulafè gets her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to ensure customer satisfaction, as well as to increase her sales and income, she has requested a fourth loan from ALIDé along with the other members of the Mahuena group. This loan will allow them to increase their business levels, as well as to expand their customer bases and have greater income.

loans.use: To buy pillows, mattresses and brooms.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidra tiene 71 años y está casada con el Sr. Pablo de 65 años. Tienen 4 hijos mayores los cuales están casados y formaron sus propias familias.
La Sra. Isidra tiene una despensa en su casa desde hace 18 años aproximadamente,  aparte de los productos de despensa también se dedica a la venta de bebidas y cuenta con una mesa de billar que le genera ingresos adicionales en especial los fines de semana.
Solicita de este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, azúcar, harina, fideos en forma mayorista, también invertirá en la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, vinos y cervezas de distintas marcas y medidas.
texts.en: Isidra, 71, is married to Pablo, 65; they have four adult children who are married and have formed their own families.  Isidra has had a home-based grocery store for about 18 years.  Aside from the usual grocery items she also sells beverages and has a pool table that generates extra income especially on the weekend.  She’s requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles at wholesale.  She will also buy beverages like soft-drinks, wine and beer in various sizes and of different brands.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Caaguazu Poty 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Caaguazu Poty II  está formado con 15 Integrantes,   son personas humildes pero cada una de ellas tiene la voluntad necesaria para salir adelante.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Fidelina, quien tiene una despensa en su casa. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y por medio de su negocio ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan y está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de esta ayuda para la compra de leche, panes, verduras, frutas y demás, para poder tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Ellas están contentas por trabajar en el grupo e ir creciendo.
texts.en: The “Caaguazú Poty II” committee has 15 members who are humble but each also has the necessary determination to get ahead.  One of these women is Fidelina who has a home-based grocery store.  She’s a very hardworking, enterprising woman who has been able to give her family everything they’ve needed and get ahead by means of this business.  She’s asking for this help to buy milk, bread, vegetables, fruit, etc. to have a good variety available to offer her customers.  All of them are happy to work in this group and to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Mirian Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Mirian tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos. Reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Mirian se ha dedicado a oficios domésticos, pero hace 2 años decidió establecer un negocio de pulpería, ella vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, granos básicos, pan, carnes, refrescos, productos de higiene y limpieza, manteca y golosinas.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  15,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de carnes,  azúcar, abarrotería, productos de limpieza, golosinas, refrescos y medicamentos.
Al hacer esta inversión Mirian piensa que sus clientes aumentaran al igual que sus utilidades.
Ella tiene como meta apoyar a sus hijos con la educación para que sean buenos profesionales y además quiere que su negocio sea competente.
texts.en: Mirian, 30, is married and has three children.  She lives in company of her family in a rural community in Nueva Frontera Municipality, Santa Bárbara Department.  Mirian did domestic chores but two years ago decided to open a grocery store where she sells basic staples, basic grains, bread, meat, soft-drinks, cleaning and personal hygiene products, lard and snacks.  She’s currently asking for a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy meat, sugar, groceries, cleaning supplies, snacks, soft-drinks and medicine.  Mirian thinks that by making this investment her customers as well as her profits will increase.  Her goal is to support her children’s education so that they will be good professionals; she also wants her business to be competitive.

loans.use: to buy meat, groceries, cleanins supplies, snacks, soft-drinks and medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, raw materials, nails, etc.

loans.name: Lineth Sarahí

texts.es:
La señora Lineth tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo. Reside en una comunidad urbana del Municipio de Olanchito, Departamento de Yoro.
Lineth se ha dedicado a estudiar, pero hace 5 años decidió establecer un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda, ella vende blusas, pantalones, short y camisetas.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  10,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de 2 fardos de ropa, uno con ropa variada y el otro con  blusas de moda.
Lineth piensa que el préstamo le servirá para aumentar su clientela y sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
En el futuro ella desea convertirse en distribuidora de ropa usada en fardos y asi dar una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Lineth, 21, is single and has a son.  She lives in an urban community in Olanchito Municipality, Yoro Department.  Lineth went to school but decided five years ago to start selling used clothes; she sells blouses, pants, shorts and t-shirts.  She’s currently asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy two bales of clothes, one with assorted clothes and another with in style blouses.  Lineth thinks that the loan will help her increase her clientele and her income which will allow her business to grow.  In the future she’d like to become a supplier of bales of used clothing to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothes (one of assorted clothes and one of blouses that are in style).

loans.name: Dania Yulisa

texts.es:
La señora Dania tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos. Reside junto a su familia en una comunidad urbana del Municipio de Olanchito, Departamento de Yoro.
Dania se ha dedicado a oficios domésticos, pero hace 4 años decidió establecer un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ella vende blusas, pantalones, short, sandalias,  y camisetas.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  10,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de camisas, blusas, pantalones, mochilas, zapatos y camisetas.
Dania piensa que el préstamo le servirá para atraer más clientela, ya que teniendo producto nuevo la visibilidad de su negocio es mejor.
Agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, ella espera salir adelante con su familia y y crecer en su negocio día a día.
texts.en: Dania, 33, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in an urban community in Olanchito Municipality, Yoro Department.  Dania had worked doing domestic chores but four years ago decided to start selling new clothes.  She sells blouses, pants, shorts, sandals and t-shirts.  She’s currently asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy shirts, blouses, pants, backpacks, shoes and t-shirts.  Dania thinks that the loan will help her attract more customers because having new products will increase improve her business’ attractiveness.  She is grateful for the financial support provided.  She hopes to get ahead with her family and that her business will grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, backpacks, shoes and t-shirts.

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Blandine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Maximin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Blandine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Blandine assure avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix huit ans, Blandine vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et des sachets de pur water dans son quartier. Blandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Blandine et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.

The group's representative, Blandine, is raising her hand in the photo. She is 39 years old and married to a man named Maximin. The couple have three children, some of whom are in school.  All three of their children are their dependents.  Blandine lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various expenses of the household with her husband.

She has been selling telephone recharge cards as well as PUR water purifier sachets in her neighborhood for almost 18 years. She buys her merchandise at a market located in Benin.

It is the third time that Blandine and the other members of the NONVIGNON group are requesting financial assistance from Alidé in order to bolster their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' expectations.

The group's previous loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards and PUR water purifier sachets.

loans.name: Vila

texts.es:
La señora Vila tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos. Reside junto a su familia en una comunidad urbana del Municipio de La Másica, Departamento de Atlántida.
Vila se ha dedicado a oficios domésticos, pero hace 6 años decidió establecer un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ella vende blusas, pantalones de hombre y mujer,  camisetas, ropa interior, sandalias y zapatos.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  20,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de producto nuevo, camisas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior sandalias y zapatos.
Vila piensa que el préstamo le servirá para mantener surtido su negocio ya que se avecina la temporada de navidad, lo que ella quiere aprovechar ya que en esta temporada las ventas aumentan.
Ella espera dar a sus hijos un buen ejemplo de perseverancia y poder verlos crecer.
texts.en: Vila, 35, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in an urban community in La Másica Municipality, Atlántida Department.  Vila had worked doing domestic chores but six years ago decided to start selling new clothes.  She sells blouses, men’s and women’s trousers, t-shirts, underwear, sandals and shoes.  She’s currently asking for a 20,000 Lempira loan to buy new merchandise: shirts, blouses, pants, underwear, sandals and shoes.  Vila thinks that the loan will help her keep her business well-stocked for the approaching Christmas season; she wants to take advantage of it because sales increase this season.  She hopes to set a good example of perseverance for her children and to see them grow.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es casado y tiene cuatro hijos en nivel de educación primario, viven en casa propia ocupando una habitación en acabado de ladrillo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Alto Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

José es transportista afiliado en un sindicato de transportes, trabajando por más de ocho horas al día y con los ingresos que tiene mantiene a su familia con el pago de servicios básicos y educación de sus hijos.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de estuco, pintura y otros para la construcción de obra fina de su vivienda ya que se encuentra en obra bruta.

El sueño de Jose es mejorar la calidad de habitad de su familia y para su comodidad del mismo.

Es la tercera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y con KIVA es la primera vez.
texts.en: José’s married and has four elementary school age children.  They live in a one-bedroom, brick house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Pasankeri zone.  José is a transportation provider affiliated with a transportation syndicate and works more than 8 hours daily.  He’s able to support his family paying basic utility costs and his children’s schooling costs with income earned.  He needs the loan to buy stucco, paint and other supplies to do the finishing touches on his house which is currently unfinished.  José’s dream is to improve the quality of his family’s and his housing conditions.  This is the third time he’s worked with Impro and first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stucco and paint.

loans.name: Mahussi Group

texts.fr: MAHUSSI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est une veuve. Antoinette est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Antoinette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les divers besoins de ses enfants. Pour y parvenir, Antoinette vend depuis près de six ans, des fruits (bananes) et des poulets de façon ambulante et à son domicile. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que, Antoinette et les autres membres du groupe MAHUSSI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MAHUSSI is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Antoinette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 41 years old and a widow. She is the mother of three children, all in school and in her care. Antoinette lives alone with her children and ensures by herself that the diverse needs of the children are met. To achieve this, she has been selling fruit (bananas) and chickens door to door and from her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the first time that Antoinette and the other members of the group MAHUSSI have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their business and responding better to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: purchase hens and bananas to sell

loans.name: Torin Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo en la Colonia Torin de la ciudad de Caaguazú con 18 señoras, con el propósito de  integrar el programa de comités de mujeres. Ellas desean una superación personal y laboral para el logro de un mejor bienestar de sus familias.
Elva es parte del grupo, y cuenta que vende verduras de todo tipo, con lo que está saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada, que toda su vida ha trabajando, y lo seguirá haciendo para darle un buen futuro a su familia.
Solicita del crédito para la compra de verduras, y así tener siempre surtidos su negocio para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The committee started in the colony of Torin in the city of Caaguazú with 18 women. It was set with the purpose of being part of the women committee program. They want to overcome both personal and working obstacles to get a better well-being for their families.

Elva is part of the group, she says she sells all kinds of vegetables which are helping her to get through in life, she is a woman who has made a lot of sacrifices, she has worked all of her life and will continue to do so to give her family a good future. She wants the loan to buy vegetables so she can have plenty to offer in her business so she can continue to work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Wibatin Group

texts.fr: WIBATIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Mahussi dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Mahussi est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Daniel. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Mahussi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Mahussi mène comme activité la vente des vivres (huile végétale, riz) dans un marché du Bénin.
