Airesty is a 30-year-old fish vendor from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fish-selling business for more than two years now.

Airesty works hard to assist her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her six children.

Airesty is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell in the neighborhood. With this, she will be able to sell more fish and increase her profit and income. Airesty has hopes of expanding her business in the future and continuing in supporting her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the neighborhood

loans.name: Athuman

texts.en:
Athuman, 34, lives in a common-law union with his wife and three children in a town in a rural area of Mwambalazi. He earns a living selling cereals from his home.

Athuman is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy more merchandise such as dry maize, beans, and other products. His goals are to improve and increase his sales and grow as an individual merchant to provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as dry maize, beans, and other products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has a boutique business in Naivasha town where she sells clothes for men, women and children. She also sells cosmetics and has been in this profitable business for two years.

She is 38 years old and married to Titus, who is a fisherman. They have two children.

This is her first loan amount and she plans to buy extra stocks of clothes to sell. She also plans to expand her range of cosmetics. This will enable her to meet her clients' demands more efficiently as well as make more profits, which she will use to expand her business.

Rose hopes to grow her business by adding more variety of clothes and beauty products. She also hopes to open another boutique business.

loans.use: To buy extra stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with no children. She is not looking after any family member. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expense is rent.

She has been operating a salon from a shop she rents for the last two years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 100,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her buy more hair oils and shampoo for use in the salon. 

Her challenges include seasonality and thieves in the market. Her dream is to acquire a big salon with all the beautifying facilities. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans.

loans.use: To buy more hair oils and shampoo.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: This is Manzura, from the north part of Tajikistan. Many children love her and know her as a "lovely nanny." She is 48 years old, married and has 3 children. She is a very kind and hardworking woman. In order provide her family with good living conditions, she has served as a childcare worker for a number of years. Some people bring their children to Manzura’s house and she cares for those children while they work. She loves children and is happy about her job. Manzura wants to repair her house, that is, change the doors, toilets and so on, but her income is small and she can’t do it. She is asking for a loan of 3000 TJS to buy building materials to repair her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials like toilets and doors for repairing her house.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 29 years old.  He lives with his mother and sister in Vanadzor. Armen manages his own business producing metal-plastic doors and windows, which he has been doing for four years. He equipped his garage for his workshop where he runs his business. 

Armen has a good reputation and many orders for metal-plastic doors and windows.  He fulfills private orders from Vanadzor and the nearby area as well. Armen buys materials for his production, such as metal-based laminate, rubber, glass, bars, etc,. from wholesale markets. 

Amend is requesting his second loan from Nor Horizon for 300,000 AMD, which he will use to buy a large lot of glass for his window production.  Thanks to his business Armen is able to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a large lot of glass.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now. In addition to this, she runs a sari-sari (or variety store), selling various materials to the people in her locality. 

Angelita is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs and additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, sodas, snack foods and other items. With this, Angelita will be able to enhance her profit and income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs and additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, sodas, snack foods and other items.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 37-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be a social and talkative woman. She operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a commercial business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kes (Kenyan shilling) loan to buy goats to slaughter for meat to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy goats to slaughter for meat.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is 44 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in their own house that lacks both electricity and running water. After becoming unemployed, Hamadi decided to undertake his own business and he now buys milk from dairy farmers to package and resell. His business generates a good income and he uses a bicycle to transport and distribute the milk door to door. He also sells from his home. 

Hamadi is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy more milk to sell. His goal is to expand his customer coverage and make his business grow. In the future, Hamadi hopes to improve his income and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of milk to resell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 59-year-old married woman and mother of two adult children. She is from Nocnocan, Talibon. For the past ten years, Evelyn has been engaged in a hog-raising business and her husband works as a fisherman. She works hard to support her husband to meet the needs of her family and she uses her business income for the expenses of the family. Evelyn wants to expand her business but lacks the capital to do so.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. She will use her loan to produce good-quality pigs. In the future, Evelyn wants to make her business sustainable and progressive so that it will continue to generate income.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is 49 years old and lives with his life partner in their house. He has been selling cereals for many years and has gained a lot of valuable experience in sales and this has given him a good income. Abdalla sells from his home. He already has a large clientele and people prefer his products because the cereals are of good quality and price and he provides excellent service. Abdalla is known for his friendliness and honesty and he is a entrepreneurial man who is dedicated to his work. He is always looking for better alternatives to get himself a more prosperous future.

Every day, he works as hard as he can because he knows this is the only way to achieve what he wants. Lately, he has increased his sales, and he wants to take advantage of this with an investment in his business, for which he is asking for a loan from Yehu that would permit him to buy cereals in bulk.

loans.use: to buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Lucia Otilia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Otilia es comerciante de uno de los Mercados de la ciudad de León, Sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:00 am para iniciar sus labores a las 7:00am finalizándolas a las 5:00 pm, viaja a Managua una vez por semana a comprar  su producto. Ella es madre de cuatro hijos y  están  de edad escolar, 

Inicio su negocio de forma ambulante con venta de ropa en pequeña cantidad actualmente tiene puesto fijo y realiza esta labor desde hace 10 años.

El crédito que solicita a Ceprodel lo utilizara para la compra de nuevos productos que estén a la moda tales como: ropa interior, trajes para niños, toallas, sabanas, shores, camisa, etc. Permitiéndole atraer más clientela e incrementando las ventas y ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

Los sueños de la señora es que su negocio se mantenga para que sus hijos logren a  ser  profesionales coronando una carrera en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lucia Otilia is a stallholder in one of the markets in León city.  She leaves home at 6 am, begins work at 7 am and finishes at 5 pm.  Once a week, she travels to Managua to buy stock.  She is the mother of four school-age children.

She originally set up in business as a street vendor, selling clothing in small quantities, but has now had a permanent market stall for 10 years.  

She is applying to Ceprodel for a loan which she will use to buy new, fashionable products such as: underwear, children's clothing, towels, sheets, shorts, shirts, etc.  This will enable her to attract more customers and increase her sales and earnings, which will go towards supporting her family.  Lucia's dream is to see her business continue so that, in the future, her children can have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy underwear, children's clothing, towels, sheets and shorts

loans.name: Guillermina Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Guillermina Mercedes, tiene un negocio de  elaboración  de comida tales como el tradicional y riquísimo gallo pinto, huevos fritos y otros deliciosos platillos   en la ciudad  León Nicaragua desde hace veintiún años, sale de su casa desde las 4:30 am y abre su negocio a las 5:00 am  finalizando  a las 10:00 am con el desayuno,  por la tarde vende fritanga de 4:00 a 8:00 pm realiza este trabajo para la mantención de su hogar ya que es madre soltera. 

Doña Guillermina está solicitando un crédito el que utilizará  para  comprar  arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, leña, platos, cucharas desechables y bolsas plásticas. 

Doña Guillermina Mercedes   ha mejorado su   nivel de vida y de su familia ya que con los ingresos obtenido producto de los créditos brindado por Ceprodel  ha remodelado su humilde vivienda dándoles más comodidad a sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Guillermina Mercedes owns a business making food such as the traditional and delicious "gallo pinto" (made with rice and beans), fried eggs and other tasty dishes in the town of León, Nicaragua. She's been in this line of work for 21 years. She leaves her home at 4:30 a.m. and opens her business at 5 a.m. She finishes with breakfast at 10 a.m., and in the afternoons she sells cracklings from 4 to 8 p.m. She does this work in order to support her household, since she's a single mother.
Guillermina is requesting a loan that she'll use to purchase rice, beans, olive oil, chicken, firewood, plates, disposable spoons and plastic bags.
Guillermina Mercedes has improved her and her family's living conditions, because with the profits she obtained as a result of the loan provided by Ceprodel she has remodeled her humble home. That way she provided more comfort for her four children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, olive oil, chicken, firewood, plates, disposable spoons and plastic bags.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Isata. She is married and has no children. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for assistance.  

In 2009, Isata established her business, selling cooking oil, palm oil, sugar, cosmetics, gari (cassava flakes) and biscuits. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le600,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. Isata requires a loan in order to buy more cooking oil, palm oil, sugar, cosmetics and biscuits to resell. In the future, Isata plans to expand her business to generate more income and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and other products to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is still running her bakery, which she has been managing during the past nine years. Thanks to her business, Marine provided for her family, paid for her children’s education and organized her elder daughter’s wedding. 

Marine used her previous Kiva loan to buy a small truck for her business. Now she is asking for a 1,100,000 AMD (Armenian dram) loan to buy a lavash (traditional Armenian bread) baking stove. This stove will allow Marine to diversify her bakery assortment and thus attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a lavash (traditional Armenian bread) baking stove

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella is a fish vendor from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines, and has been selling fish for more than ten years. 

Evella is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell to the people in her community. She will be able to augment her earnings with her loan. In the future, Evella dreams of having a sustainable and lucrative business venture.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Teuta

texts.en:
Teuta is a single 33-year-old woman. She lives with entire family in the northern part of Kosovo. Twelve years ago, she began to run her own boutique. She started with a small shop, selling clothes, and has been able to expand since then. She sells different types of clothing for people with different tastes and styles. Her business is the main source of income for her family. 

Her customers usually are people living in her area. She is a very hardworking women. She considers her business to be fairly profitable and with the income she earns, she helps her family with household expenses. While running her business, she makes new friends, which then increases her customer base. 

With the requested sum of 1,500 euro, she will invest in buying more clothes and increase her business. She also promises to be punctual in making her payments. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy clothes and increase her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 55-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. Conchita has been engaged in tuba (coconut wine) vending, farming, and raising hogs for several years now. Her husband works as a farmer. Conchita works hard to support her husband to meet the needs of her family. She is planning for the expansion of her business but lacks capital. 

Conchita is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops, feed for her pigs, and more coconut wine to sell in the neighborhood. In the future, she dreams of exploring new business ventures to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops, feed for her pigs, and buy more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 33-year-old married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has two young children. She is engaged in a peanut-butter-making business.  She has been in the business for three years. She sells peanut butter to the community as a source of livelihood.

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 pesos to buy ingredients such as sugar, peanuts, cooking oil and a plastic canister in order for her business to grow. Gemma would like to see her business successful in the coming years so that she can support her children especially their educational needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, peanuts, cooking oil and a plastic canister.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 61 years old and mother of two adult children. She is a merchant from Bien Unido, Bohol. For the past 11 years, Erma has been running a sari-sari (variety) store which is her sole source of income. 

Erma is requesting a loan to buy additional stocks to sell in her store such as canned goods, soda, snack food, soap, toiletries, and other household essentials. Her loan will help her to attract more customers thus increasing her sales and profit. In the future, she wants to make her business successful, sustainable, and productive.

loans.use: to buy stock such as canned goods, soda, snack food, soap, toiletries, and other household essentials

loans.name: « Alide » Group

texts.fr: Le groupe « ALIDE » est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Homédokpo est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Homédokpo a eu fréquenté l’école. Homédokpo est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Joseph. Le couple a six  enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Il y a près de vingt ans que Homédokpo mène comme activité, la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, riz, etc.) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille. Homédokpo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Homédokpo désire obtenir un crédit ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe « ALIDE ».
texts.en: The Alide group is composed of three friends. The group’s representative, by the name of Homédokpo, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She has had some formal schooling. She is 52 years old and married to Joseph, a tailor. They have six children, all in school and two still in their care. For almost 20 years, Homédokpo has been selling staple foods (corn, rice etc) out of her home, allowing her to help support her family. Homédokpo stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of increasing product stock and better meeting customer demand, Homédokpo, along with the other members of the Alide group, would like to obtain a loan.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 43 years old, married, and the mother of three adult children between 18 and 24 years old. Her husband is a secondary school teacher and he provides additional income for the family. For the past 10 years, Joan has been practicing mixed farming including keeping cows, pigs, and poultry. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES that she uses to support her family.

Joan is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD to buy 300 chicks to rear and sell and also to buy chicken feed. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to support her business. In the future, Joan plans to grow her business and start a green house farming business.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicks to rear and sell and also to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 35 years old, married, and the father of three children ages eight, 12, and 15. For the past seven years, he has been practicing both pig farming and mixed crop farming in Kiambu. Cyrus earns a 25,000 KES income that he uses to provide for his family's basic needs. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a registered client.

Cyrus is requesting his first 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, potato seedlings, and animal feed. He is anticipating that his loan will increase his income and he will pay school fees for his children and build a bigger structure for his pigs. In future, Cyrus desires to increase his business and be able to give his children the best education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, potato seedlings, and animal feed

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Mrs. Ghazala is a 35-year-old married woman and an active lady. She is working very hard to improve the status of her family. She is in the business of selling bed sheets. Approximately three years ago she decided to start her own business. She purchases cloth from the market and sews bed sheets, covers and pillows at home and sells them to customers at a very reasonable price. Owing to the good quality of her work, she gets many orders from her customers on a regular basis. 

She has many orders in hand, and to complete these orders she has requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan rupees for purchase of bundles of cloth in various colors and designs according to the taste and choice of her customers.  She dreams of expanding her business and increasing the income for her household, so that her whole family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa, 42, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Renato and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Theresa operates a poultry supply store where she sells different supplies, mostly for cocks. She sells by the kilo and  her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more feed and other supplies needed to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Theresa hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a 28-year-old married man with one child living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in spare parts and he started the business with the proceeds from the retail shop which he still operates. His business is located on a busy street thus attracting many customers, and he also chose the spare parts business after assessing the increasing demand for spare parts since the motorcycle business employs 80% of the youth in his area. His major challenge is inadequate capital to meet the high demand while his business dream is to have a wholesale shop. Amon is requesting a loan to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children, two of whom attend school.  She is not looking after any additional member of the family.  

She has been running a restaurant at the market for 3 years, working seven days a week.  She does not earn any additional income.  

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to enable her purchase foodstuffs like green bananas, rice, flour and cooking oil plus charcoal for cooking.  

Her challenges include seasonality of supply and transportation.  Her dream is to be able to serve all dishes.  She joined MCDT because she needed more capital.  She rents a house with access to electricity but without piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent, school fees and transport.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like green bananas, rice, flour and cooking oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children and two of them are attending school.  She is not looking after any additional family members.  

She has been selling secondhand handbags in the market at retail for the last five years, working six days a week.  She does not earn any additional income.  

She has requested a loan of 100,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to enable her stock more used handbags for sale.  Her challenges include transportation.  Her dream is to expand her business as she enrolls for bigger loans and accumulate profits that will enable her acquire land.  She joined MCDT to get loans.  She stays in her husband's house with access to electricity but not piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, transport and rent.

loans.use: To buy more used handbags

loans.name: Fyuduruva

texts.en:
Fyuduruva is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in dried fish vending for 8 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Fyuduruva is asking for a loan for the expansion of her business. She is requesting a loan to buy buckets, a storage container for the fish, etc. Through this, she will be able to produce more dried fish, thus increasing her sales and profit.

In the future, Fyuduruva has hopes of making her business a success. She also adds that she wants to save money for future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy buckets, a storage container for the fish, etc.

loans.name: Sumayiya

texts.en:
Sumayiya    lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children and two of them are attending school. She does not look after any other family members.

She has been selling crushed building stones from the stone site at retail for ten years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income. 

She has requested a loan of UShs 100,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy more big stones that she crushes for sale. Her challenges include thieves and the manual work involved in crushing the stones. Her dream is to be able to accumulate profits for self development.  She joined MCDT because of the low interest rate charged on loans. Sumayiya rents a house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy more big stones that she crushes for sale

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he utilized to buy more quantities of fish and meat products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan that he will be utilizing buy more quantities of fish and meat products needed in his business. He also has a junk shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jonathan hopes his business grows in the coming years. He faithfully meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Nuluat

texts.en:
Nuluat lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

She has been making snacks for sale at wholesale from the market for the last three years, working six days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 100,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder and cooking oil. Her challenges include unstable prices of ingredients. Her dream is to expand her business and be able to supply snacks to other people's selling centers. She joined MCDT for self development. She rents a house without access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma, age 58, lives in the town of Msambweni. He lives with his wife and their four children. Four years ago, he decided to establish his own business, a grocery store, in order to generate greater income for the household.

He and his wife run the grocery store, and they wait on their customers all day. In order to keep his business stocked, he has decided to request a loan for 50,000 KES. He will buy beans, rice, flour, sugar, salt, bread, detergents, soft drinks and dairy products.

He has managed four loans from Yehu, counting this one. They have helped him increase his inventory and his clientele. His goal is to make his business grow more and to have it generate good income so that he can support his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, flour, sugar, salt, bread, detergents, soft drinks and dairy products for resale.

loans.name: Mejdije

texts.en:
Mejdije is a twenty-four-year-old single woman. She lives in a village in the northern part of Kosovo with her entire family. Based on family tradition, Mejdije works in agriculture. She is working on her land, planting wheat. 

She helps her family to secure the wheat and pay for production for next year and in this way they cut expenses. Mejdije is requesting a loan in order to buy wheat seed, guano, and pay for working her land. This loan will help them to improve and secure the wheat for one year. 

This loan will help her to increase production of wheat. In the near future she hopes to get married and to have her own family.

She is very thankful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy wheat seed, guano, and pay for working her land

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala is a 54-year-old married woman and has been engaged in the seaweed farming business for more than six years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.
 
Gonzala is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, rope and fuel for the fishing boat and to pay for the school fees of her children.

In the future, Gonzala wants to expand her business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, rope and fuel for the fishing boat and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase necessary equipment and materials for her beauty salon. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting her family's personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy new equipment and materials needed for her business. Her profits will definitely help sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products needed for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 53 years old. She is a widow and lives alone in the capital city of Georgia. Her economic activity is a newly started business, in particular, a small store where tobacco and beverages are sold.  Rita requested loan from local financial institutions for the business expansion, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and insufficient experience in her business.

Rita was involved in the same type of business for eight years. She had rented a commercial place and had a grocery store. This business was recently stopped because of financial problems. Her loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program provides business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Rita will expand and develop her store. She will purchase more tobacco and beverages at wholesale prices and sell for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase her monthly income and Rita will reinvest the received profits in the same business. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco and beverages in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. Guillerma has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years.
 
Guillerma is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, buckets and other items. With this loan, they will be able to enhance their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Guillerma dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, buckets and other items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last seven years, Margaret has been hawking jewelry as a primary business and "farmers choice" products which include raw sausages and hot dogs as a secondary business to residents of Kangemi. From this business she earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.
 
Margaret is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more jewelry, sausages and hot dogs from the "farmers choice" for resale. She will plough back the profit into her business.

In the future her dreams are to work hard and open a "farmers choice" outlet.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and "farmers choice" products for resale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 39 years old, married and has three young children. She is from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in retailing herbal medicine and food supplements for several years now as the source of her income.
Hilda is asking for a loan to buy additional herbal medicines to sell to her customers. 
In the future, Hilda has hopes of expanding her business to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional herbal medicines to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Raïssa

texts.fr: Raïssa est une jeune femme âgée de 24 ans. Elle detient un petit atelier de surfillage dans un quartier de la ville où elle exerce de plus 1 an. Grace a son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine, elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela, Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt qui lui permettra d'acheter une nouvelle surfileuse. Avec les bénéfices générés, elle voudrait s'offrir d'autres machines, et souhaiterait, dans un avenir propre, voir son activité évoluée et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Raïssa is a young woman of 24. She owns a small sewing workshop in a district of the town where she has been working for over a year. Thanks to her energy and to her competence in this sector, she has a growing clientele that she would like to continue to satisfy. To do this, she requests a loan that will enable her to buy a new over-edging sewing machine. With the profits that this will generate, she would like to purchase other machines, and hopes to extend her activity and improve her living conditions in the near future

loans.use: to buy an over-edging sewing machine.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Парвиз родился 1992 года. В 1998 году поступил в школу и в 2009 году успешно окончил. После окончания школы он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Медицинский Университет. Данное время студент 3 курса. Он очень способный молодой человек. Парвиз увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу. Родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в этом году. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте вместе поможем молодому специалисту окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем.
texts.en: Parviz was born in 1992. He starting his schooling in 1998 and successfully completed it in 2009. After graduating, he entered the Tajikistan State Medical University where he is currently in his 3rd year of studies. Parviz is a very capable young man. In his free time, he reads foreign literature and plays sports. His parents are not in a position to be able to afford his tuition this year, so Parviz is seeking a loan to pay for his university studies. He is waiting for your kind assistance. Let's help this young specialist finish university so he can put his knowledge to use in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a very hardworking man with rich experience in his work. He is grateful for the support he is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. He was able to increase sales from the past loan. He is optimistic that this loan will be of great help.

He has applied for this new loan to increase the number of animals he raises. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase cows and goats to sell. This will give him an opportunity to improve his family's living conditions. Ali hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is a 46-year-old married woman from Loon, Bohol.She has three children. The oldest child is 16, while the youngest is 12 years old. 

Pablita raises hogs. Aside from the hog raising business, she also sells snack foods like banana cue, boiled camote, and puto (rice cakes) to nearby school cafeterias in her community during school days. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy feed for the hogs and merchandise to resell, such as bananas, sugar, rice and camote.

Pablita hopes that her business will be successful so that she can support her family as well as support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and to buy additional merchandise for resale, such as bananas and sugar.

loans.name: Mabal

texts.en:
Ms. Mabal is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is been in the business of stitching trousers and shirts for three years. Due to the insufficient income of her husband, she is working hard to help meet the expenses of her family members. 

Mabal has gotten a lot of appreciation in her community through her great knowledge of doing this. She makes enough to lead a decent life. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for two years. Mabal has gradually improved her business with the support of the foundation. 

To cope with increasing demand, she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase reels of threads in different colors and another sewing machine for her daughter to assist her in completing orders on time. She dreams of opening a shop in her community to display her work. She is hopeful to earn more profits and intends to utilize part of them for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase reels of threads in different colors and another sewing machine so her daughter can assist her.

loans.name: Izo

texts.en:
Izo is 46 years old and lives in Zestaponi district.  She is married and has two children, 22 and 16 years old. The younger daughter goes to the local school. Izo’s husband works as an electrician locally and gets a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business with three milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides, the family has a vineyard and harvests grapes in the late summer. The family does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good quality harvest. Izo has beehives with bee colonies as well and gets honey. She sells cheese products, grapes and on average 240 kg of honey per year. Izo is very hard-working woman with a great experience in her work
She requested a loan to purchase wooden materials to renovate the floor of her home. Izo had planned to sell the milk cow to buy the materials, so with this credit the family will be able to keep their livestock and receive the same amount of milk for the dairy. The monthly income of the family will not decrease and family members will improve their living conditions as they will live in more comfortable environment. Izo awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase wood materials to renovate the floor of her home.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra is 35 years old, married and the mother of a one-year-old son from San Miguel, Bohol. Isidra and her husband work as rice farmers, and she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. This loan will allow them to produce a healthy crop with a high yield. In the future, Isidra dreams of expanding her business and making it a bigger success. Her goal is to save money for the future schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Кумри  занимается куплей  продажей риса и бобовых культур.   Она  замужем, имеет 3 детей.   Этим бизнесом она занимается более 20 лет.   В семье дополнительный доход от мужа  который занимается деканством. Но доход мужа очень маленький.    Старший сын на заработках в  Российской Федерации но не имеет пока возможности присылать деньги родителям.   Кумри женщина трудолюбивая и очень любит свою работу и хочет помочь своей семье.  Она планирует на полученный кредит закупить несколько мешков риса.  Заранее благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Kumri is married and has 3 children. She sells rice and beans, and has been working in this business for more than 20 years. Her husband earns a living by working in the farming sector, but his income is very low. Their eldest son works in the Russian Federation but does not yet have the possibility of sending money to his parents. Kumri is a hard-working woman who loves her work and wants to help her family. She plans to use the loan to buy a few bags of rice. She is grateful in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a few bags of rice

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is married and has two children. He describes himself as a humble and focused man. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, flour and cooking fat. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His store is located in a high-potential business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of transportation. Henry will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy home products to sell. His business goal is to be the best businessman he can be within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell in his retail business

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi, 34, is married and lives in her own house in the urban community of Msambweni. Six years ago, she decided to start a small business where she sells coconuts and cassava. She sells them wholesale to people who later sell them retail in the municipal market. She is requesting a loan for KES 10,000 so that she can buy more coconuts and cassava to sell to her customers. Mwanaidi thinks that these extra supplies will allow her to increase her sales and earnings.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts and cassava to meet her customers' increasing demands.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
The desire to improve is one of this man’s most important dreams. He lives with his family group in a house he owns.

Hamisi operates a cafe and has many customers who prefer his business because of the quality of his food, the affordable prices, and above all, for the quick service. He’s an active, enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and who has many goals he wants to reach. He’s working hard to attain a more prosperous future for his family. He feels very happy with his business, but knows that he has to make it grow if he’s to rise out of poverty.

Demand has increased in recent weeks, so he’d like to invest in the purchase of necessary ingredients to make his products, which is why he’s asking Yehu for a loan to buy wheat flour, meat and vegetables, among other ingredients. He has good payment references and is very responsible. He assures that he will be able to repay the loan, while at the same time trusts that he will be able to bring economic security to his home.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, meat, vegetables and other ingredients for his business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of four school-age children, from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in the business of raising hogs. Jocelyn works hard to earn a living, so that she can help her husband to meet the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. Jocelyn dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Dawood

texts.en:
Dawood is a 53-year-old man. He is married and has children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

For the past three years, Dawood has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable business. It is the main source of income for the family, but Dawood also needs more support to cover the costs from time to time.

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary spare parts for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Dawood to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his transportation business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a mother who is very responsible and dedicated to her home, with a great desire to improve in life. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. Mwanasiti works hard selling coconuts in the market, as she has for three years, growing her sales little by little. Because her supply needs are now greater, she is requesting a loan from Yehu, with which she can buy a greater quantity of coconuts wholesale at lower prices and thus make better profits. Mwanasiti has high hopes for this loan, and she expects great improvement.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts wholesale to resell in the market.

loans.name: Mahuclo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUCLO est formé de trois personnes qui sont des sœurs et des amies. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Semedeton Appoline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Semedeton Appoline est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un certain Justin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Semedeton Appoline a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de deux ans que Semedeton Appoline exerce comme activité, la vente de divers (vivres) dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Semedeton Appoline désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Semedeton Appoline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUCLO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mahuclo group is made up of three people who are sisters and friends. The leader of this group, named Semedeton Appoline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time that this group requests financial support from ALIDé, aiming to raise the standard of their activity. Semedeton Appoline is 29 years old and is married to a certain Justin. The couple has three children, all of which go to school, two of whom at their expense. The couple lives with their children and provides together for the various family needs. Semedeton Appoline stopped attending school at the secondary level. For about two years, Semedeton Appoline has been selling various grocery products in her district; which enables her to provide for her family's needs without too much difficulty. In order to satisfy her customers' demands more adequately, Semedeton Appoline wishes to reinforce her activity. To do so, with the other members of the Mahuclo group, she requests a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 45-year-old courageous lady and a mother of two. She started sewing after getting a divorce from her husband. She is well familiar with the techniques of stitching and enjoys a great client list as she has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She makes enough to lead a decent life without the support of her husband. Being a single parent, Tasleem needs to bear the expenses of her children and also of all the family members as she doesn’t want to be a burden upon her parents. 

In order to cater more customers, Tasleem needs to buy additional raw materials, such as spools of thread, packs of laces and buttons in various colors and designs. For this, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000. This will help her to meet orders on time and make her customers happy and satisfied. She wishes to use the earned revenue to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials, such as spools of thread, packs of laces and buttons in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан молодой человек в возрасте 36 лет.  Он женат и имеет одного ребенка.   Хасан занимается купля продажей автомобильных запчастей и  этим  делом он занимается более 5 лет.  Его жена домохозяйка, и иногда помогает своему мужу в бизнесе выходя  на  рынок вместо него.  Дополнительный доход у Хасана от автостоянки который находится   рядом с его местом деятельности.  Он там построил не большую площадку для стоянки автомобилей. Продаж автомобильных запчастей это его основной доход поэтому он хочет расширит свой бизнес. Для этого он обратился в нашу организацию Арванд.  На полученный кредит хочет закупить запчасти для импортных автомобилей.  Заранее благодарит за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Hasan is 36 years old, married, and has 1 child. He has been in the business of selling auto parts for more than 5 years. His wife is a homemaker and occasionally helps her husband by working in his place at his market stall. Hasan has supplementary income from the parking lot near his place of business, as he has built a small parking area there. His main source of income is the sale of auto parts and he wants to expand his business. For this reason, he has approached Arvand for a loan. He plans to use the money to stock up on auto parts for imported cars. He gives his thanks in advance for your assistance and support.

loans.use: to  buy auto parts

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 25 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling donuts, ice blocks and cream buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy goods for her business. In the future, Nora hopes to expand her canteen. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, ice, flavour and baking soda.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is a 53-year-old married woman and a rice farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been in this business with her husband for more than fifteen years. Josefa wants to access a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the rice farm. With this loan, they will be able to produce a good quality harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four school-age children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Flordeliza has been engaged in retailing fruits and vegetables for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income. 

Flordeliza is asking for a loan to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell in the market and to pay for the school fees of her children. 

Flordeliza dreams of expanding her business in the future and continue to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell in the market and to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Denise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Denise est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Olivier. Denise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Denise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Denise vend depuis dix sept ans, de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Denise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Denise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The ENAGNON group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Denise, is the one who has her hand raised in the photo. 

Denise is 31 and married to a man named Olivier. Denise did not attend school. The couple have six children, all enrolled in school and under their care. Denise lives together with her husband and her children. The couple share the responsibilities of supporting the household. 

In order to be able to contribute to covering household expenses, for 17 years Denise has been selling cooked food (rice with sauce) in her neighborhood. This activity allows her to cater for her needs without great difficulty. She buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. 

Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow the turnover in her business, Denise, together with the other members of the group called ENAGNON, is requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to raise the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Ms. Sakina is a 38-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has had a beauty parlor business for the past three years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is doing business selling waste yarn, but he lacks for work due to a recession here in Pakistan, and he cannot earn enough to support his family well. Sakina's beauty parlor is small but fulfills the needs of the local community, and she is the highest earner in her household. She is a mother of two children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 20000 to buy more products for skin care, hair treatment, and make-up kits to cater to more customers at a time. She shared that her dream is to run a training school in her community. She is teaching make-up and hair styling skills to two students at this time, so they can help her expand her business, as well as earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy more skin care and hair treatment products and make-up kits to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary hopes to continue the success she has had since she started getting loans from Kiva and Yehu. She is thankful beyond words. Mary says that the previous loans have had a highly positive impact, not only on her business, but also on her standard of living. She is currently asking for a new loan to expand on her clothes-selling business. She will buy bales of clothes for resale. Mary has also been able to open a food stall, which is doing well.

loans.use: buy bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Ms. Saima is a 26-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of sewing for many years. She is well familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation, and she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. 

At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She has four children, among them only one daughter is school-going.  She is striving to meet their demands including food, clothing and education. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet daily expenditures. 

Saima started her business to contribute to the family income. She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy spools of threads and packs of buttons and zippers in different colors. Then she would be able to meet the demand of her customers without fail. 

Saima hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy spools of threads and packs of buttons and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in food vending. She sells snack foods like "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick) to people in the community. 

Julita is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending such as bananas, sugar, cooking oil and to buy materials for the renovation of her house such as nails and wood.

In the future, Julita has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending such as bananas, sugar, and cooking oil and materials for the renovation of her house

loans.name: Brunilda

texts.en: Brunilda is 23 years old, married and the mother of two little children. She and her family are members of the Egyptian ethnic community of northern Albania. Although this is a small group of people, she and her husband have earned a living for the last five years by providing transportation services. Both of them work hard and they have been doing well, even though, like many people in their community, they have no education. Their goal is to make sure that their children get a good education and a head start in life. That is why they are requesting a loan to repair the truck they use to provide transportation services.

loans.use: to repair a truck.

loans.name: Soso

texts.en:
Soso, 54, is from a small village in Zestaponi District. He lives with his wife and 3 children (29, 26 and 24 years old). Soso and his son work as bakers in their village and get a monthly income. The family also runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a pig, 2 milk cows and 2 calves. Soso also owns 0.3 hectares of land, where he sows different kinds of vegetables. Besides, he has a vineyard with 300 vine trees. Soso sells grape and dairy products locally at the open market for a good price. He works hard to ensure good harvests. 

Soso requested a loan to purchase building materials for a shed. The existing shed is too small and doesn’t allow him to implement his future plans of farm expansion. After building the shed, he will purchase additional livestock and keep the animals in the shed. It will increase the family's income, for Soso will receive more milk for his dairy business. With increased income, the family will improve its living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his cattle shed.

loans.name: Mbete

texts.en:
Mbete, age 43, is an industrious and a responsible woman. She sells fruit at the market such as mangoes, bananas, and oranges, among others. Mbete’s business volume is stable, but it increases on the weekends since there are more people who are on their way to the market. 

Mbete lives with her husband and her daughter. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of fresh fruit, which will help to improve her profit margin.

loans.use: buy a larger quantity of fresh fruit

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёре 42 года. Она очень добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Сайёра замужем на доброго человека, которого зовут Мамурчон и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж работает в колбасном цехе и получает 1000 сомони каждый месяц. Сайёра более 20 лет занимается земледелием и скотоводством. Сайёра и Мамурчон стараются обеспечить детей хорошим жилищным условием и образованием. Старший сын Сайёры Кодирчон учится на 1 курсе Медицинском Государственном Университете Таджикистана. Так как в этом году Сайёра не получила хороший урожай, так она не в состоянии оплатить за учебу сына в университете. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Сайёра и Кодирчон ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sayora is 42 years old. She is a very conscientious and hard-working woman. She is married to a kind man named Mamurchon, and they have 5 children. Her husband works at a sausage factory and earns 1,000 Tajiistan Somoni per month. For the last 20 years, Sayora has been raising cattle and growing crops. She and her husband try to provide their children with good housing and education. Their eldest son, Kodirchon, is now a first-year student at the Tajikistan State Medical University. However, because Sayora did not have a good harvest this year, she is not in the position to be able to pay for her son's tuition. For this reason, she is seeking a loan so she can cover the cost of his studies. Sayora and Kodirchon are waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education

loans.name: Snobar

texts.en: Ms Snobar is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children. To fight poverty and help support her family, she has for many years run a beauty parlor in a small corner of her two-room house. She and her daughter work hard day and night to build up the parlor's reputation so that they can provide for their family. Her husband works in a factory and does not earn enough money to pay the family's expenses. Thanks to her hard work, Snobar has gained popularity in her community and has a good client list. She is requesting a loan for Rs 20,000 to buy furniture and equipment, such as hair dryers, rollers and streamers, to allow her to serve many customers at a time. She hopes this loan will allow her to earn more money. Her goal is to provide a better life for her family and quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy furniture and equipment for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a 23-year-old woman and runs a "sari-sari" or convenience store business in her town in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various goods to the people in the community. 

Lea is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as rice, sodas, snack food, canned goods, soap and toiletries, among others.

Lea dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as rice, sodas, snack food, canned goods, soap and toiletries, among others

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is from Terjola district of West Georgia. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children (2 and 6 years old). Maia’s parents-in-law are pensioners and her husband runs a grocery shop. Maia is involved in agricultural business. In particular, she has a milk cow and produces cheese which is sold at the local open market. Besides that, the family owns a vineyard and agricultural land, which is cultivated and different kinds of vegetables are grown. They do all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. 

Maia runs a poultry business as well. She has a chicken shed where 700 chickens are raised. The family sells the hens in their district and the nearby town. 

Maia requested a loan to expand the chicken shed. The existing one is too small and doesn’t allow her to implement her future plan of farm expansion. After the building is expanded, Maia will purchase more chickens and keep them in the shed. She will be able to sell more hens and increase the family income. With the increased profit Maia will develop the family business as well as improve their living conditions. She awaits your support

loans.use: to expand her chicken shed

loans.name: Kayonza Twimukye Group

texts.en: Anna is requesting a loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell to her customers in the town of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is 38 years old, a very hard worker, and she and her husband have six children. She adores her children and wants to see them get a good education. She is trying to do this by running a farm and a produce-selling business. Like most people in her line of work, her main challenges are price fluctuations and the high costs of transportation. Her goal is to open a food store that can serve her whole community. She is a member of a loan group where each member guarantees the other's repayments

loans.use: to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба обратилась в МДО "Арванд" чтобы  начать строительство дома. Она замужем и имеет двоих сыновей.  Муж и ее 2 сына  работают в мастерской , штукатуроми    и отделочниками. Они делают ремонт в помещениях и иногда по возможности  сами производят ремонт в своем доме чтобы сэкономить, но основную работу делают мастера.  На следующий год Махбуба  хочет женить одного  из сыновей,  и комнат в доме мало, для этого они с семьей решили построить еще пару комнат для новой семьи. На полученный кредит она хочет купить строительные материалы. Благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Mahbuba has approached MDO Arvand so that she can begin a construction project in her house. She and her husband have 2 sons. Her husband and sons work doing plastering and finishing. They renovate buildings, and whenever it is possible, they do repairs in their own house to save money, but most of the work is done by builders. Mahbuba wants to help one of her sons with his marriage plans next year, but there are not enough rooms in their house so the family has decided to build a couple more rooms for the newlyweds. Mahbuba will use the loan to buy construction materials. She is grateful for your financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ma. Annabelle

texts.en:
Ma. Anabelle is a merchant and runs a convenience store in her place in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various goods to the people in the community. This is the source of her income.

Ma. Anabelle is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell such as noodles, sodas, canned goods, snack food and others. Through this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store thus increasing her sales and profit.

In the future, Ma. Anabelle dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell such as noodles, sodas, canned goods, snack food and others

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Ms Nadia is a 28-year-old widow. She is a passionate woman and has been in working making and selling clothes for the last three years. She has excellent skills of fashion designing to make elegant dresses for women in her community. Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers a variety of clothes in different designs and colors to her customers and makes enough money to lead a decent life. 

Nadia is a loving mother of one child. Unfortunately her husband died a year ago and she came back to her mother's home but she did not become a burden on her parents and started her own business to contribute to the family income. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy a stock of more cloth of different colors in various designs with more packs of lace, thread and buttons. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of more cloth of different colors and various designs with more packs of lace, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru: Насим обратился в МДО "Арванд", чтобы увеличить свой ассортимент.    Он торгует   продуктами  питания.    Насиму поставляют товар продуктовые фирмы оптом и это ему обходится дешевле.   У него есть постоянные клиенты которые приобретают товар  оптом и в розницу.     Это единственный доход у Насима  и он старается развивать свой бизнес.    На полученный кредит Насим хочет закупить продуктов питания и увеличить свой ассортимент.
texts.en: Nasim turned to the MDO Arvand in order to expand his merchandise selection. He sells groceries. His suppliers sell him food items wholesale, which costs him less. He has loyal customers buying both retail and wholesale. This  is Nasim’s only source of income, and he tries to grow his business. He would like to use his loan  to stock up on groceries and expand his selection.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en: Adolf is a thirty-eight-year-old hardworking man with five children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is involved in a number of business activities which include rental houses, agriculture and also selling clothes. With the proceeds he has been able to build a house and pay school fees for his children. Like all good fathers he has dreams of educating his children up to the University and establishing for them sustainable income-generating activities. His business desire is to be one of the modern farmers in the area and to own a fashion school despite challenges of inadequate capital and unpredictable seasonal weather changes. Adolf is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 35 años, es una mujer  buena, amable, trabajadora y muy luchadora.  Es madre soltera de 02 hijos de 13 y 3 años, ellos son su motivo de inspiración y esfuerzo a diario para poder brindarles lo mejor en educación y alimentación: Ella vive en casa de su madre a lado su hermana, hijos y su padre. El trabajo de Elizabeth consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas y helados de frutas regionales. Trabaja así desde hace más de 02 meses y lo realiza sola logrando abastecerse con lo que hace, además tiene tiempo disponible para poder realizar múltiples actividades en su hogar. Sus ventas aumentan en el horario de salida de los escolares, así como en las entradas, recreos. Este será el préstamo número 09 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio o trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará productos para vender en su negocio, entre las cosas que comprará están, gaseosas, caramelos, galletas, golosinas, entre otros, ya que desea implementar su negocio para tener mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elizabeth, age 35, is a good, kind, and very hard-working woman. She is a single mother of two children, ages 13 and 3. Her children are her inspiration and her motivation to work every day in order to be able to give them the best education and food. She lives in her parents' home with her sister, children, and parents. She sells pop and frozen local fruit. She has had this business for over two months and she works alone. She buys her stock with her income. She also has free time to do multiple activities in her home. Her sales are highest when the schoolchildren are heading to school, when they are leaving at the end of the day, and at recess. This will be her ninth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since she will feel secure in advancing with her business. She also promises once more to repay her quotas as she did with her previous loans. She is happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and united. With the requested 2500 soles, she will purchase products to sell in her business. This includes: pop, candies, cakes, crackers, and other items. She wants to stock her business and have more products to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy pop, candy, cakes, crackers and sweets.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 47 years old,  married, and has five children. With the help of her husband (in the photo), she has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. He assists her in purchasing stocks of goods from the markets.  They offer various daily use goods at reasonable prices. They have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store for grocery items. 

Sajida is motivated to provide for her family. To expand her business, she is requesting a loan for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues for personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Fatima Flor Maria

texts.es:
Fátima, necesita realizar una nueva compra de mercadería, por esto solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la inversión en maíz, quesillo, aceite, chicharrones, gas, que son los más utilizados en el negocio, con esto podrá aumentar la capacidad de sus ventas.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le proporciono lo necesario para atender bien a los clientes, mejorando sus ingresos a la familia.
texts.en:
Fátima needs to make a new purchase. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will allow her to invest in corn, cheese, oil, pork scratchings, and pop. These are the most-used items in her business. With this investment, she will be able to increase her sales capacity.
She feels that her previous loan provided her with the necessary capacity to serve her clients well and improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, oil, pork scratchings, and pop.

loans.name: Simon Gathogo

texts.en:
Simon, who has been in the transport business in Naivasha town for more than seven years, also runs a barber shop business. He used his previous loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business. It was profitable and he was able to repay his loan.

Simon is requesting his fourth loan, which he will use to buy shaving equipment, such as shaving machines, razors blades, hair oil, shampoo, and a mirror, for his barber shop business. He hopes to earn additional profits, which he will use to open another barber shop.  Simon hopes to buy a plot of land and build both commercial and residential houses.

loans.use: to purchase shaving equipment.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is 48 years old and lives in a one-bedroom house with her husband and daughter. When her husband failed to find employment, Shahnaz decided to use the skill her mother had taught her at a very young age and earn something for her family. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation and started stitching for females in the neighborhood. Now she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 as she is planning on buying a new stitching machine and raw material such as spools of thread and packs of lace in different colors. In this way she could meet the growing needs of her customers. Shahnaz is passionate about her work, and informed us that she is planning on preparing fancy dresses so she can sell them to retailers in the city of Lahore.

loans.use: To buy a new stitching machine and raw material such as spools of thread and packs of lace in different colors.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice owns a beauty salon business in Nakuru town and has been in the business for fourteen years now. She is 43 years of age, married to Edward, and they have three children.

This is her second loan and she plans to buy salon equipment like a drier, hair clips and gloves that are used when washing hair. She also plans to buy cosmetics, which she will use as well as sell to her customers. She will use the generated profits to buy more variety of cosmetics.

Eunice hopes to grow her business by opening a big cosmetics and boutique business.

loans.use: To add more salon equipment.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Nelva de 20 años es una joven muy empeñosa y trabajadora , desde muy joven decidió llevar una vida independiente con el afán de brindarle a su madre todo el apoyo necesario. Es propietaria actualmente de una vivienda hecha a base de material noble. Desde niña apoyaba a su madre en toda actividad productiva en el campo, ya cuando era mayor de edad, heredó las parcelas de cacao e inicio con su labor de manera más dinámica.
Es así que se convierte en una productora de cacao, y ya lleva 2 años en el se esfuerza y saca adelante este negocio, asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros. Admite que el trabajo en el campo es muy duro y mas aun cuando es el cacao, pues requiere de mucha atención. Para ella es reconfortante vender los granos secos a los acopiadores quienes cotizan un buen precio. Ya iniciándose la temporada de mantenimiento es necesario contar con injertos, plantas de almácigo, materiales para fumigación y sacos de abono orgánico para lograr sacarle el máximo provecho a sus parcelas, adicional a ello necesita contar con jornaleros quienes cobran la mitad de su salario por adelantado.
Planea seguir trabajando con la misma motivación y fuerza, pues desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad, en donde planea cederle a su madre por ser un trabajo muy tranquilo y evitar que continue trabajando en el campo. Este viene a ser su crédito número siete, agradece desde ya por la confianza que MFP le brinda  ya que considera es un gran apoyo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital para contratar jornaleros, así como sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Nelva, age 20, is an earnest and hardworking young woman. At an early age, she decided to live independently with the intent of providing her mother with all the necessary support. She currently owns a home made of solid materials. When she was a girl, Nelva helped her mother with all of the farm work until she became an adult. She then inherited plots of cacao and started her work in a more proactive manner. This is how she became a cacao producer. Nelva has already been doing this for two years and has been able to move forward with her business. She also has the help of day laborers. Nelva admits that the work in the fields is very hard, especially with cacao since it requires a great deal of attention.
