She finds it comforting that she is able to sell the dried kernels to traders who offer a good price.

Nelva has entered into the season of maintaining her farm by grafting plants, sowing her nursery, and acquiring fumigation supplies and sacks of organic compost. This enables her to make the most of her land. In addition, she needs to hire day laborers and must pay half their salary in advance.

Nelva plans to continue working with the same level of motivation and effort. She would like to open a grocery store in the city so that her mother can have a peaceful job without having to work in the fields. This will be her seventh loan. Nelva is grateful for having the trust of MFP, which she considers to be a great help. This loan of 1,000 PEN will complement her existing capital so that she can hire workers and buy sacks of organic compost.

loans.use: to hire workers and to buy sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 25 years old, married, and has three children.  She raises poultry in Nakuru town, which she has been doing for three years.  She sells  chickens and eggs mostly to hotels and chicken traders in the market place. 

Everlyne is requesting her second loan, which she will use to buy chicks especially broilers and layers for rearing.  She will sell them at a profit during the festive season.  Everlyne hopes to expand her business by supplying more chickens and eggs to markets within and out of Nakuru town earning additional income and providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks.

loans.name: Mahudjro 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO 1 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Makilawé Rose est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Makilawé Rose est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Antoine. Makilawé Rose n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Makilawé Rose est mère de trois enfants, tous scoarisés et à la charge du couple. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Makilawé Rose vend depuis dix ans des vivres à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Makilawé Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Makilawé Rose sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 1.
texts.en:
The MAHUDJRO 1 group is composed of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is their third time seeking financial support from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The representative of the group is Makilawé Rose, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Makilawé Rose is 35 years old, and she is married to a man named Antoine. She never attended school. The couple have three dependent children, all in school. 

To help with the various household responsibilities, Makilawé Rose started selling food from her home ten years ago. This activity allows her to provide for her family. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase her sales and revenue, Makilawé Rose is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the MAHUDJRO 1 group.

loans.use: to buy food to sell from her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy undergarments, towels, sheets, shorts, blouses, and mosquito netting.

loans.name: Josie A.s' Group

texts.en:
Christian is the featured leader of this group of primary school teachers in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. She was born in Baiima Madun village, in Eastern Sierra Leone 55 years ago. Christian is a widow with 4 children. She has served in the teaching profession for 32 years now. She will use her share of the loan to buy house building materials like sand, stones, cement, windows, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling. 

With the help of this loan, Christian and her colleagues will be able to buy or invest in items that their mere salaries cannot let them do. But with the help of this loan, some of them will be able to invest in businesses, pay school fees for their children, buy household furniture or house building materials, etc. and at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayment on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like sand, stones, cement, windows, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling

loans.name: Toribio Marcial

texts.es: Toribio  Marcial de 47 anos de edad, soltero con un hijo de seis anos, de la localidad de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Toribio tiene por actividad la económica la venta de verduras y fruta en un lugar especifico de  la localidad. Él tiene ocho anos de dedicarse a dicha actividad. El negocio lo inicio cuando tubo que dejar su  trabajo como asalariado  él se desempeñaba como escolta y se vio en la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo propia para sacar adelante a su hijo. El ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería en la compra de verduras y frutas  como: pipián, ayote, chayote, plátanos, sandias, naranjas, guayaba, cálala, limones. Y de dicha forma  aprovechar la temporada navideña donde las ventas y utilidades aumentan. Toribio Marcial agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a pequeños comerciantes y países pobre como es Nicaragua  para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Toribio Marcial, 47, is single and has a six-year-old son.  He’s from León which is located in the west of the country.  Toribio’s economic activity is selling fruit and vegetables in a specific spot in town.  He’s been doing this for 8 years.  He started the business when he had to leave his salaried job; he used to work as a bodyguard and needed to find his own source of employment to be able to support his son.  He’s been responsible with his previous loans; he’s repaid them all in a timely manner.  

He needs the loan to invest in working capital and stock up on vegetables and fruit like pumpkins, squash, chayote, bananas, watermelons, oranges, guavas, passion fruit and lemons.  In this way he’ll be able to take advantage of the Christmas season when sales and profits increase.  Toribio Marcial is grateful to Kiva lenders who provide small merchants and poor countries like Nicaragua with a way of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 30 years old, married, and has six children. She is in the business of milk sales, which she has been doing for many years. She has one buffalo in milk, four goats, and two sheep. Abida used to purchase goats and sheep and sell them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha.  Eventually, she purchased one buffalo to initiate the business of selling milk.  She sells milk, along with butter, cheese, and ghee, to many of her neighbors. She has a good client list and her business is good enough to lead a decent life. Her husband also helps in her business.  

Abida is requesting a loan for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy another buffalo to increase her milk production. She would be able to serve more people in her community. She wishes to utilize part of revenue on the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Lagunaita Group

texts.es:
El comité Lagunaita esta en su segundo ciclo, gracias a que sus miembros desde el principio se han esforzado por salir adelante e ir creciendo. Ellas además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también hacen actividades juntas, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para lograr sus sueños.
Una de las historias es de la Sra. Maura quien se dedica a la venta de sábanas, naranjas y miel de caña esto gracias al crédito que se le otorgó en el ciclo anterior. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sabanas para la venta, ya que tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
The committee named “Lagunaita” is in its second loan cycle. From the very beginning, its members have strived to succeed and grow. They work independently, but also participate in joint activities so that they can help one another achieve their dreams.

One such member is Sra. Maura. She was able to sell bed sheets, oranges, and sugar cane syrup thanks to the loan she received during the previous cycle. Maura is a hardworking person who wants to move forward. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy bed sheets to sell since she has orders that she would like to fulfill.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 38 años, es padre soltero y su único hijo se llama Mildred y tiene 18 años. Él es poseedor de una vivienda hecha a base de madera. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y carga a distintos puntos interurbanos y rurales. Lleva desempeñándose como tal desde hace 5 años con un vehiculo que su padre le transfirió por un precio módico y desde entonces recorre varias rutas de la selva. 
Considera su actividad muy agradable, sin contar que su padre también se dedicaba al transporte y quiso desde niño ser parte del rubro llegando a ser un buen sustento para su hogar. La actividad tiene muchos puntos buenos pero como todo comercio posee ventajas y desventajas, pues debe lidiar en muchas ocasiones con algunos conductores que optan por una competencia desleal perjudicando el normal desarrollo de su labor. 
Al tratarse de un vehiculo motorizado no esta garantizado el funcionamiento permanente de la unidad es por ello que desea realizarse un mantenimiento integral para así tener su herramienta de trabajo en las mejores condiciones.
Tiene en mente tener su propio taller de reparación de neumáticos y otros servicios adicionales con el objetivo de consolidarse económicamente y brindarle a su joven hijo una educación superior de calidad que el nunca tuvo. Muestra su agradecimiento por ser participe de un segundo préstamo por parte de MFP con quien piensa tener una larga relación para a futuro acceder a un préstamo mayor, Agradece desde ya a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por la acogida que le brindaron desde su reciente ingreso.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles le brindará a su vehículo un mantenimiento para tenerlo en optimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Víctor, 38, is a single father of a son, Mildred, who is 18.  He owns a wood house.  He works transporting passengers and cargo to various interurban and rural spots.  He’s been working like this for five years using a car his father sold him at a modest price; since then he’s been covering several jungle routes.

He considers his work pleasant not discounting that his father was also in transportation and he wanted to be in this line of work too since he was a boy; it’s now become a good source of support for his home.  The activity has many good points but like all commerce it has advantages and disadvantages because he often has to deal with some drivers who opt for unfair competition thus hurting his normal work flow.

Because he deals with a motor vehicle, its perfect functioning isn’t guaranteed always and this is why it must undergo periodic general maintenance so that he can have a work tools that’s in better working conditions.

He plans to open his own tire repair and other services shop in order to consolidate economically and provide his young son with the higher education he, himself, never had.  He is grateful for being participant in a second MFP loan and hopes to have a long relationship so that in future he can access a larger loan.  He thanks his fellow communal bank members in advance for the welcome they gave him when he joined recently.  He will use the 2,000 new soles to service his car so that it will be in optimum working conditions.

loans.use: to take his car to the mechanic.

loans.name: Appolinarie

texts.en:
Appolinarie is married to a farmer. They have four children. She has been a maize farmer for the past 30 years. She would like to get a Kiva loan to upgrade her farming, through buying fertilizer and supporting labor costs during the period of maize production. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business of maize production for further sustainability.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase spices such as chilli, salt etc for spices selling business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is married and has a young family of five children between the ages of three months and seven years. Four of them are in junior primary school. He is a farmer who grows maize and beans on a large scale for sell and also for his family consumption. He started the serious farming in 2006 to meet the needs of his growing family. With the loan he will be able to buy seedlings for planting during this rainy season. His main challenge is the unpredictable seasonal changes and price fluctuations. His dream is to build a house for himself and his family. With a house he will be free from the burden of renting. This in turn will enable him to comfortably pay his children's fees.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

Pauline has been selling vegetables in the market for seven years at retail and works six days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of UShs 100,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes and onions for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Pauline's dream is to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans and accessibility of the loans. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, water and rent.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes,and onions

loans.name: Amalia Sarai

texts.es:
Amalia, quiere realizar una nueva inversión, comprándose maíz, quesillo, aceite, gas, para elaborar la venta de las pupusas, para solicita un préstamo nuevamente que le de los recursos necesarios y poder realizar la compra.
Considera que su trabajo en la pupuseria ha mejorado, desde su último préstamo obtenido, ha logrado abastecer el negocio y contar con lo necesario, en su familia, comenta que sus ingresos han sido estables.
texts.en: Amalia wants to make a new investment buying corn, string cheese, oil and gas to make pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] to sell.  To do so, she’s requesting a loan once again to have the resources needed to make the purchase.  She feels that her work in the pupusa shop has improved since her previous loan.  She’s stocked the business and she has what’s necessary.  Family income has been stable.

loans.use: to buy corn, string cheese, oil and gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and gas.

loans.name: Kizito

texts.en:
Kizito is 29 years old,  married, and has two children. He has spent 14 years as a maize producer. 

Kizito is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, string cheese, pork, oil, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Mirsa Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Mirsa  tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo, reside en compañía de madre, hijo y un hermano en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula,  Departamento de Cortés.
Mirsa anteriormente se dedicaba a oficios domésticos, hace 9 años que decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones para dama y caballero,  blusas, camisas, faldas, y sandalias. Ella se vio motivada a  generar ingresos por su propia cuenta debido a que se separo de su esposo. 
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras para surtir su negocio con ropa nueva y de la temporada como ser pantalones, blusas, camisas, sandalias, faldas y short, todo para damas caballeros y niños.
Agradece el apoyo financiero de ODEF FINANCIERA S.A y KIVA. A futuro ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio y colocarlo en un local propio ya que actualmente funciona en su casa.
texts.en: Mirsa, 43, is single and has a son.  She lives with her mother, son and brother in an urban community in San Pedro Sula, Cortés Department.  Mirsa used to do domestic chores but nine years ago decided to start her own business selling clothes like women’s and men’s pants, blouses, shirts, skirts and sandals.  She was motivated to generate income on her own because she separated from her husband.  She’s currently requesting a 25,000 Lempira loan to stock her business with new, seasonal clothes like pants, blouses, shirts, sandals, skirts and shorts for men, women and children.  She is grateful for the financial support from ODEF Financiera, S.A. and from KIVA.  In the future, she’d like to make her business grow and set it up in its own space because it currently operates from home.

loans.use: to stock up on new seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Sarvine

texts.en:
Sarvine is 34 years old and a mother of four children. Her husband works as a farmer as well. With the loan, she wants to buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in agriculture.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Rosa Ramona

texts.es:
En temporada de Noviembre y Diciembre es bonito visitar El Sauce, ir sobre la carretera entre montañas florecidas de Madroños blancos, el cual es el árbol nacional de Nicaragua y que rico es sentir aquel aroma natural y puro de esa flor que se acostumbra a adornar a la virgen María los siete de diciembre donde se celebra la gritería.

En este pueblo lleno de tradiciones religiosas habita doña Rosa Ramona, una señora de 48 años, madre soltera de tres hijos que se ha esforzado por criarlos sola sin la ayuda del padre y que gracias a su labor que ejerce como cocinera en un centro de enseñanza ha tratado de darle lo mejor que puede, bajo su pobreza no les ha faltado alimento ni educación.

En la actualidad por las circunstancias de la vida y por su bajo salario tiene que alquilar una vivienda donde habita con su familia pero recibió la ayuda de un proyecto del municipio que obsequió pequeñas vivienda a las personas de escasos recursos.
 Hoy ella quiere ampliar un poco más esta casita para tener más espacio para su familia por lo que solicita un crédito y la ayuda de KIVA a través de Ceprodel para la construcción de un cuarto por lo que necesita, dicho financiamiento con el cual comprará ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
It’s nice to visit El Sauce in November and December and travel through the mountains covered in white strawberry trees which are Nicaragua’s national tree.  And how wonderful it is to smell the natural, pure aroma of that flower that’s used to decorate the Virgin Mary on December 7th when the Gritería feast day is celebrated.  

Rosa Ramona, 48, lives in this town that’s full of religious traditions.  She’s a single mother of three children she’s striven to raise by herself with no help from their father.  Thanks to the work she does as a cook at a school she’s tried to give them the best she can and despite her poverty they’ve never lacked food or schooling.

Because of her life circumstances and because of her low salary, she has been renting the house she lives in with her family but she’s gotten help from a municipal project that offers small houses to people of limited resources.  She’d like to enlarge this house a bit so that the family can have more room and needs a loan to do so.  She’s asking for Kiva’s help through Ceprodel to build the room she needs.  She will use the financing to buy bricks, cement, sand, metal sheeting and roof purlins as well as to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, metal sheeting and roof purlins and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: San Jaun Group

texts.es:
El Comité " San Juan", es un comité con  integrantes de la cuidad de Curuguaty, se encuentran en el segundo  ciclo. Todas son mujeres trabajadoras y humildes, el  comité está situado en la Colonia 7 monte.
El Comité San Juan  se compromete  de seguir pagando con la misma responsabilidad que venían haciendo, y de esa forma no defraudar la confianza depositada en ellas. Eulalia, una de las miembros, vende bebidas y solicita de este crédito para poder comprar gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y demás y así seguir vendiendo sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Juan" is a group with members from the city of Curuguaty. They are in their second loan cycle. They are all hard-working and humble women. The communal bank is located in the Colonia 7 Monte. The communal bank "San Juan" is committed to continue paying with the same responsibility that have been, so as to not lose the confidence placed in them.  

Eulalia, one of the members, sells drinks and is requesting this loan in order to buy soft drinks, beer, wine, and the like and thus to continue selling her products.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, wine, and the like.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Olkalou town where he plants cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes. He is 60 years old and married to Priscah. They have two children.

This is his second loan and he plans to use it to buy farm materials such as manure, fertilizer, and seedlings as well as pesticides to prevent his crops from being destroyed by pests. He anticipates making more income, which he plans to use to expand his farming and practice zero grazing.

In the future, John hopes to invest more in his farming business, make more income and buy a plot to build rental houses. This will also enable him to have enough income to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 49 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has spent 24 years in the farming business. He would like to get a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Waridi

texts.en:
Waridi is a woman of high integrity and respect in her community. She has the urge to move forward and become a prominent person in her vicinity. She wants to expand to her business, and therefore she is making new investment.

She will invest in the purchase of sugar, beans, flour, snacks, etc. Waridi says that the previous loan was of great help to her and was able to transform her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase of sugar, beans, flour, and snacks.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a fish monger living in Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has three children. Fish is among the staple foods for the residents living around Alex. 

Alex has been operating the business for five years. This is his source of income. He also runs rental houses.

Alex joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of fish and cooking fat. His ambition is to be the largest supplier of fish to the areas around Mariakani town.

The extra income will also form part of Alex’s future savings and help him pay for his children’s school fees. The challenge currently is high cost of transport, since Alex has to go and look for fish stock. He desires to set up a retail shop in the future and also to build a rental house.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish and cooking fat.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 26 years old and sells clothes in Naivasha town. He is married to Mary who is a business lady and they have two children. He has been in the business for two years now and it has been profitable. Besides his clothes selling business, he sells scrap metals to metal manufacturing industries.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. Due to the high demand from his customers, he anticipates generating more profits, which he will use to buy scrap metal to sell.

Wilson hopes to expand his clothing sales business by selling and supplying clothes to other markets outside Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah lives with her children in the rural area of Tiribe. She is a divorced woman and she is passing through various challenges.

Through her efforts and dedication she has a simple business that is her main source of income. She works making garments in her small tailoring workshop. She has worked all her life in order to earn her daily bread, not having any other income. This is why she wants to keep her business active for a long time. She is an entrepreneur who is dedicated and charismatic in her work.

Many people favor her because her business always has a variety of intimate apparel and the best of everything at very good prices. Thanks to her experience and good service to her customers, she has earned their confidence and each day they solicit her more.

She made the decision to ask for a loan from Yehu in order to invest in her business buying more fabrics, and a new sewing machine. All this is done in order to supply her business so that the customers always find what they are looking for. Thus, she hopes to expand her earnings to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Colette

texts.en:
Colette is 58 and a widow with one child who is 32 years old. With the loan, she wants to buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ricardo Junior

texts.es: El Joven Ricardo es soltero, tiene 18  años de edad, estudia Mecanica Automotriz en un instituto de prestigio,  Ricardo  escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y tiene las capacidades y habilidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente en la Mecanica Automotriz, actualmente Ricardo trabaja en una empresa de taller mecanico realizando sus practicas profesionales  , Su sueño de Ricardo es un dia estudiar en la universidad y ayudar  su familia, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar la pension de sus estudios,  Ricardo cumplira sus metas con mucho trabajo y agradece a edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en: Ricardo is 18 years old, he is single and he is studying Automobile Mechanics at a prestigious institute. Ricardo has chosen this career as it is his vocation and he has the capacity and ability to develop professionally. He is currently working. Ricardo is currently doing his internship and working in a repair shop. Ricardo’s dream is to attend university and to help his family. In order to keep growing, he is requesting a new loan to pay for his education fees. Ricardo will achieve his goal through his hard work and he is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 67 years old and is widowed. She has six children and they all attend school. With this loan, she wants to buy more fertilizers and use it for labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Miwadagbe Group

texts.fr: MIWADAGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Cathérine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Simon. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cathérine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Cathérine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis plus de dix ans, Cathérine vend du riz préparé accompagné de sauce à son domicile. Cathérine s’approvisionne auprès d’un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Cathérine et les autres membres du groupe MIWADAGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Miwadagbe is a group with three members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Cathérine, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years of age, and is married to a dressmaker named Simon. The couple has three children, all at school and all under their care. 

Cathérine did not go to school. She lives together with her children and her husband, and together with him is responsible for the various household expenses. For more than 10 years, Catherine has sold cooked rice with sauce from home, and she gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the first time that Cathérine and the other members of the Miwadagbe group have requested the financial support of ALIDé. They have done so to increase their working capital and business, as well as to better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: To buy rice and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Oscar Cayetano

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa, tienen un hijo de 22 años de edad, Oscar posee una siembra de Yuca y cultivo de maíz, desde muy joven realiza estos cultivos, lo aprendió con sus padres.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para aplicarlo al cultivo de Yuca, este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de invertir en el cultivo y sacar una buena cosecha y de ella sacar provecho con las ventas.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a  su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 57 years old. He lives with his wife; they have one son who is 22 years old. Oscar has a crop of yucca and corn. Since he was very young he has planted crops. He learned from his parents. 

He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer for his yucca crop. This loan will give him the opportunity to invest in his crops, and result in a good harvest that will allow him to have better sales. 

His goal is to strengthen his business and provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crop of yucca.

loans.name: Regena

texts.en:
Regena, a 42-year-old married mother of four children aged 26, 24, 22 and 20 years, has been operating a restaurant for three years now, earning a monthly income of KES 31,500. She has requested her first loan of KES. 20,000 to purchase bales of flour, a bag of rice, and a bag of sugar. The profit she earns from this business will help her to buy a refrigerator.

She dreams of seeing her children reach higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase bales of flour, a bag of rice and a bag of sugar.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак   женщина в возрасте 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Сама она вместе с мужом    более  15 лет занимается  откормом скота.  В наличии имеет около 8 голов мелко рогатого скота. Муборак содержит скот у себя дома и она  очень хорошо разбирается в преимуществах своего дела, знает когда закупать и продавать скот. Также ее муж выращивает сельскохозяйственную культуру(пшеницу, кукурузу) .  Весной  и  летом  он продаёт свой урожай. Их дети пока учатся в школе. Все их доходы уходят на проживание и они не как не могут  увеличить количество голов скота и улучшить жизненные условия .  Муборак  на полученный кредит   хочет купить скот и увеличить свое стадо.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку!!!
texts.en: Muborak is 37 years old, married, and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She and her husband have been raising cattle for 15 years. They currently have around 8 head of livestock which Muborak raises at home. She is very knowledgeable about her business, and knows the best times to buy and sell. Her husband also grows agricultural crops (wheat and corn), and sells his harvests in spring and summer. All the earnings of both Muborak and her husband go towards supporting the family, so they haven't been able to increase the number of cattle they have, which would allow them to improve their standard of living. Muborak wants to use the loan to buy cattle to increase her herd. She thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support!!!

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 50 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Evaristo quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tienen 05 hijos y juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Alicia es la venta de comida rápida como salchichas más papas fritas, salchicha con pollo frito, para eso instala todos los días su freidora, mesas y sillas, sobre un espacio acondicionado en su casa, y cerca a ella hay calles muy transitadas. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su pareja. Por lo contrario, le cansa tener que instalar y desinstalar todos los días su puesto de ventas, pero esa no la desanima y desea continuar trabajando. Además comenta tiene planes de ampliar su espacio para poner más mesas y sillas, así atender a un mayor número de clientes. Este será el préstamo número 15 con la institución MFP. Por tanto agradece de contar con un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de estar bien con su banco comunal pues pudo observar que es un grupo unido y espera que sigan de la misma manera. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas, así como ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas rápidas como papas y pollos en mayor volumen y a menor precio.
texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old. She is a hard and dedicated worker, with a strong desire to get ahead. She lives with her partner, Evaristo, who works in sales. Together they have five children and they live together in their own home. Alicia makes a living selling fast food, like hotdogs with french fries and chicken with french fries. For this business everyday she sets up her fryer, tables and chairs, in a space set aside for this in her home. Close to her home there are streets that are very busy. She considers her business to be profitable because it gives her good income. She likes her business because it generates income to cover household costs and to help her husband. However, it is tiring to have to set up and take down her sales stand everyday, but this does not discourage her and she has the desire to continue working. She also said that she has plans to expand her sales space to be able to fit more table and chairs, which will allow her to attend to more customers.  

This will be the 15th loan she has taken out through MFP. She is very thankful to be able to have a small loan, which allows her to reach her goals. She is happy with her communal bank because she can see that it is a united group and she hopes they will continue in the same way. With the amount of 2500 nuevos soles that she has requested, she will invest in buying tables and chairs, as well as the ingredients for her fast food, like potatoes and chicken, at wholesale so that she can get a better price.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and chickens as well as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Christophe is 34 years old, married to a farmer, and the father of four children. In farming for 16 years, Chrisophe is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor to replace the cost of human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and meet labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: José Martin

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente La perla del Septentrión es Matagalpa una bella ciudad agradable por su cálido clima y su gran producción de café, de esta hermosa ciudad es originario don José Martin, su estado civil es casado y tiene tres hijo dos en edad escolar.

José es un varón muy esforzado con buenos principio espirituales morales y ético, en la actualidad se desempeña como conductor de una empresa de servicios ya tiene más de seis años demostrando buen comportamiento laboral.

El crédito lo va utilizar para pagar mano de obra por la ampliación de un cuarto ya que le es necesaria realizar esta mejora porque su vivienda es pequeña y su familia está creciendo, don José agradece el financiamiento que se le ha venido otorgando ya que han sido de gran importancia porque con los anteriores ha comprado materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José Martin is originally from Matagalpa, "la perla de Septentrión," (the pearl of Septentrión), a beautiful city known for its warm climate and coffee production. He is married with three children of school age.

José is a very hardworking man with good principles, morals, and ethics. He is currently working as a driver for a service company. He has been working for them for six years, demonstrating his good work performance.

He will use this loan to pay the labor costs associated with the expansion of a bedroom. It is necessary to carry out this improvement because his house is small and his family is growing. José is grateful for the financing which he has been awarded. This is very important to him, because with earlier loans he was able to buy construction materials to improve his home.

loans.use: To pay the labor costs associated with the expansion of a bedroom.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana is 26 years old, married, and blessed with two children, ages 2 and 1. He sells mats and brooms, a business he started four years ago. He earns a monthly income of 28,000 KES. 

He has requested a first loan of 10,000 KES to purchase more mats and brooms for resale. The profit he earns will be ploughed back into his business. His dream is to prosper in this business, as well as to bring up a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase more mats and brooms for resale.

loans.name: Belancille

texts.en:
Belancille is 48 years old. She is married, and they don’t have a child yet. She has been a farmer for 17 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a tractor to enhance production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила живет в Каменке вместе с мужем и двумя детьми. Она занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в тепличных условиях. В основном выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис. Занимается этим сельскохозяйственным бизнесом уже 20 лет. У Людмилы 4 больших теплицы и еще две дополнительных для рассады. 
Дополнительная финансовая помощь в размере 12 000 гривен понадобилась Людмиле для того, чтобы подготовить теплицы для высадки помидор, а также закупить семена, пленку и удобрения. Людмила – очень трудолюбивая, она всегда стремится развиваться и расширять свое дело. В будущем планирует с мужем построить еще две теплицы, а также сделать дома гараж, поставить хороший забор и забетонировать двор.
texts.en: Ludmila lives in Kamenka with her husband and 2 children. She grows early vegetables in greenhouses. She plants mainly tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes. She has been working in the agriculture sector for 20 years. She has 4 big greenhouses and 2 more that are dedicated to seedlings. Ludmila now needs 12,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to prepare her greenhouses for tomato planting, as well as to buy seeds, plastic greenhouse covering, and fertilizers. She is hard-working and always tries to develop and expand her business. In the future, she and her husband plan to build 2 more greenhouses, to build a garage at home, to put up a good fence, and to put concrete around their yard.

loans.use: to prepare her greenhouses for tomato planting, as well as to buy seeds, plastic greenhouse covering, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nadr

texts.en: Nadr is a 24-year-old single man. He began his business with a small amount of capital. He operates the grocery shop you see in the picture. This business supports him and his family. He longs for his business to grow more and to be able to stock it with more products. He has been in this business for ten years. He is requesting a youth loan to purchase various grocery items, such as milk, juices, soft drinks, cooking oil, and canned food, so that he can satisfy his customers and meet their demands. He hopes to use the additional profits he expects to generate as a result of the loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase various grocery items, such as milk, juices, soft drinks, cooking oil, and canned food for his business

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras De Panimache Group

texts.es: Dominga (a la mitad de la fotografía) una mujer joven de 20 años de edad ella esta soltera y vive en Quiche. Junto a sus padres la cual se apoyan para contribuir a la economía de la familia. Ella se dedica a la fabricación de blusas típicas que utilizan las mujeres en su comunidad. Ella aprendió a realizar este trabajo  desde que tenía 10 años ya que es el primer trabajo que le enseño su madre. Ella vende su producto en el mercado local y con sus vecinos que piden estas prendas  viendo ella que su ganancia es buena y quiere seguir invirtiendo capital para seguir fabricando este tipo de prendas femeninas. Ella como  la representante de este grupo solicitando un préstamo para ampliar su negocio. Comprando variedad de hilos que utilizara para ampliar su negocio. Ella sueña que en un futuro pueda fabricar mayor cantidad de prendas y de mejor calidad ya que existen varios de sus clientes que lo piden. Las demás integrantes (las dos de cada lado de la fotografía) se de dican a esta misma actividad fabricando blusas típicas que utilizan las mujeres en la comunidad
texts.en:
Dominga (in the middle of the photograph), a young single woman, 20 years old, who lives in Quiche with her parents, is contributing to the family economy. She makes traditional blouses worn by women in the community. Dominga learned the skill when she was 10 years old – it was the first work her mother taught her. 

Dominga sells her products in the local market to neighbors who request these items. She considers her earnings to be  good and wants to invest additional capital, in order to continue making this kind of feminine attire.

As the representative of the group, Dominga is requesting a loan to be used for purchasing a variety of thread to expand her business. She dreams that in the future, she will make a larger quantity of blouses, and of a better quality, since there are already a variety of customers who are requesting them. 

The remaining group members (the 2 on either side in the photograph) are dedicated to the same activity, making typical blouses utilized by traditional women in the community.

loans.use: buy thread to make traditional blouses to sell in the community.

loans.name: Jesús De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Achuapa es un poblado que se caracteriza por ser 100% productiva en ganado por lo cual abunda la leche y sus derivados como es el queso, la cuajada y la crema.

En él han nacido y crecido personas que son de origen campesinos y que han salido adelante a punto de esfuerzo propio y que son dignos de admirarlos; tal es el caso de doña Angelita como se conoce cariños mente en uno de los barrios de la parte urbana de Achuapa, Jesús de los Ángeles es una humilde mujer de 53 años, casada con tres hijos todos independientes, originaria de una comarca ubicada a 20 km de dicho municipio que creció siendo una mujer trabajadora desde muy pequeña, ya sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de campo como es sembrar granos y ordeñar leche.

Pero ella espiraba no solo ser una mujer de campo sino sobresalir adelante y su sueño primordial era ser maestra porque le apasionaba enseñar a leer y escribir, fue entonces que se trasladó a la parte urbana para estudiar y luego ejercer su profesión que hoy le ha permitido tener un hogar digno y su propia vivienda, además de contar siempre con su finca y sus animalitos porque para ella sus raíces es importante en su vida.

Con el propósito de llegar a tener mejores condiciones de vida quiere mejorar su cocina, por ello solicita el apoyo a KIVA a través de Ceprodel por medio de un crédito  para la compra de materiales como hierro, ladrillos, piedra, cemento, arena, zinc, perlines, azulejos y pago de mano de obra el que pagará con su salario o la venta de leche de sus animales.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a village where stockbreeding is the main productive activity. This is why there is a lot of milk and many dairy products, like cheese, cottage cheese and cream.

Many people, original from the countryside, have been born and raised here, and they have got ahead in life through a lot of hard work, which is admirable. This is the case of Mrs. Angelita, as she is known locally in one of the neighborhoods that make part of the urban area of Achuapa.

Jesús de los Ángeles, 53, is a humble woman, married. She has three children, all of them independent. She was born in a district, 20 km from Achuapa. She learned to be a hardworking person already when she was a child, as her parents taught her to work the land, sow grains and milk the cows.

But she wanted to get ahead in life and her biggest dream was to be a teacher, because she loved to teach others how to read and write. This is why she moved to the urban area, to study and then work, which is how she has been able to have her own house and a decent living. Besides, she has kept her farm and her animals, because she thinks her roots are something important in her life.

With the goal to improve her quality of life, she would like to renovate her kitchen. This is why she is requesting KIVA’s support, through CEPRODEL. With the loan, she will buy materials like iron, bricks, stone, cement, sand, zinc, purlins, tiles and she will pay the labor costs. She will pay back the loan with her salary or with the money collected from selling her animals’ milk.

loans.use: to buy iron, bricks, stones, cement, zinc, purlins, tiles and to pay for the labor costs.

loans.name: Rosa Eugenia

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 22 años de edad, esta soltera, tiene un negocio de pupusas y venta de comida, este negocio tiene dos años de tener la venta, la heredo de sus padres, hoy en dia lo realiza para ayudar a sus padres.
Quiere trabajar con un préstamo para invertirlo en carne, pollo, aceite, verduras, que son utilizados en la elaboración de comida y la venta de pupusas. Esto ayudara a que Rosa incremente su clientela y mejore su inventario de mercadería.
La aspiración de Rosa es fortalecer el negocio y mejorar económicamente para tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 22, is a single woman. She sells pupusas [thick, stuffed tortillas] and other types of food. She has had this business for two years now; she inherited it from her parents. With this business, she helps them.

She would like to get a loan to buy meat, chicken, oil and vegetables, necessary ingredients for the pupusas and for the rest of the food. This will help Rosa to get more customers and improve the products she offers.

Rosa would like to strengthen her business and improve her economic condition and thus her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
Jose, tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposa en casa de sus padres, quienes dependen de él, José tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, la ocupación es la siembra de granos básicos, sembrando maíz y yuca, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, posee actualmente una siembra de dos manzanas de terreno de maíz cultivada y una de yuca.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y preparación de la tierra, compra de semilla, con estos materiales podrá seguir trabajando la agricultura.
Su aspiración es fortalecer sus cultivos, obteniendo mejores cosechas, además que con eso estará ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old and lives with his wife in the home of his parents who depend upon him. He also has a 5 year old son. 

Jose grows basic grains, sowing corn and yuca (cassava). He learned this work from his parents. At present, he has a fields of 2 manzanas (1.4 hectares) in size planted in corn, and 1 manzana (.7 hectare) planted in yuca.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to prepare the soil. With these inputs he will be able to continue working in agriculture.

Jose's aspiration is to strengthen his plantings, obtaining better harvests, and with this to help his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds, and prepare his fields for planting.

loans.name: Laurence M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are primary school teachers in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, these teachers are going to buy goods or invest in businesses or pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Samuel is the leader of this group of teachers. He is a 48-year-old man. Born in Maraka village near Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone, Samuel is married to a petty-businesswoman.  The couple has five children – two in primary school and three in college. Samuel has been a teacher for 29 years now. 

He has requested this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Adjo Group

texts.fr: ADJO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Elisabeth (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et dont un à sa charge. Elisabeth a peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis près de quinze ans, Elisabeth vend des produits divers (vivres, etc.) par le système de distribution. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Elisabeth et les autres membres du groupe ADJO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Adjo group is composed of three individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Elisabeth (raising her hand in the photo) is 30 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school and one of whom is in her case. For over 15 years, Elisabeth has been selling miscellaneous products (staple foods, etc) through a distribution system. Elisabeth stocks up at a market in Benin. Elisabeth and the other emmbers of the Adjo group are seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to bolster their working capital and their businesses and better meet customer expectations.

loans.use: to buy staple foods [for resale].

loans.name: Fredy Isai

texts.es:
Fredy, se dedica a la venta de enchape, esta casado, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad, este negocio es la alternativa para trabajar por su familia, llevando el alimento diario, además realiza labores agrícolas como la siembra de granos básicos.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprase mas mercadería, como aretes, dijes, cadenas, entre otras prendas que son necesarias para mejorar su negocio y aumentar la variedad, esto será una ayuda para sus ventas.
El considera que su aspiración es a través del negocio ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fredy makes a living selling jewelry. He is married with two children, ages 10 and 12. He chose this business to work for his family and give them their daily food. He also performs some agricultural work, such as sowing basic grains.

He is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise, such as earrings, charms, and chains, among other jewelry items. This will allow him to improve his business and increase the variety of products, which will help his sales.

His aspiration is to continue improving his quality of life through his business.

loans.use: To buy earrings, charms, and chains.

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tienen dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, ambos estudian, ella está dedicada a la venta de cosméticos desde hace cinco años, lo aprendió con una amiga.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de maquillaje, labiales, cremas, facial, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar el negocio y poder salir a vender.
Su aspiración con este préstamo es fortalecer el negocio, ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
María makes a living selling cosmetics. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband. They have two children, ages 13 and 15, both of whom are studying.

She has made a living in cosmetics sales for five years, having learned about the business with a friend. She has applied for a loan to buy makeup, lipstick, creams, and face masks. This purchase will help her to expand her business and allow her to go out to make sales.

Her aspiration is to strengthen her business with the help of this loan, providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy makeup, lipstick, creams, and face masks.

loans.name: Ednar

texts.en:
Ednar is from the Kobuleti district of west Georgia. He is 45 years old, and he lives with his wife and 24-year-old son. Ednar has a military retirement pension. 

The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land, where they grow nuts, maize and mandarins. Ednar and his family members do all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested agricultural products are sold at the local open market. Ednar is a very hard-working man, with a rich experience in his work.

Ednar requested a loan to cultivate a plot of land.   He will cover the expenses related to tilling of the land.  After the land is cultivated properly, the family will be able to get a good quality of nut harvest. The harvested products will be sold, and this will increase the family income. The increased profit will be reinvested in the family's agricultural activities. 

Ednar awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to cultivate a plot of land.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 34 years old.  He is married and blessed with two children, aged 16 and 14 years.  He owns a retail shop where he sells a variety of goods. He started this business eight months ago and earns a monthly income of KES 24,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cooking oil, bales of maize flour, sugar, and eggs. The profit he earns will be ploughed back to his business.

His dream is to see this business expand as well as to see his children well educated.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, bales of maize flour, sugar, and eggs.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres y un hermano, actualmente esta soltero, no tiene hijos, administra un taller de carpintería, esta ubicada en la casa de habitación, tiene 4 años en esta actividad como ingreso propio, pero lo aprendió hace 7 años en otro taller.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas, sierra, cepillo, taladro, entre otras que le permitan realizar mejor su trabajo, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su maquinaria y quipo.
Con este préstamo él aspira tener una carpintería mas equipada, ofreciendo mejor atención a los clientes y aportando mas a su hogar.
texts.en:
Juan is 22 years old and lives with his parents and one brother. He is currently single and doesn't have any children. He runs a carpentry workshop located in his house. He has been earning his income this way for four years, but he learned the trade seven years ago in another workshop. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of tools like a saw, a plane, a drill, and other tools that will enable him to do his work better. This purchase will help him to improve his machinery and equipment. 

With this loan, Juan hopes to have a better-equipped workshop so that he can offer better service to his customers and contribute more to his household.

loans.use: to purchase tools like a saw, a carpenter's plane, and a drill.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 35 years old. She is married, with two children, aged six and nine years old.  They both attend schools. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 30 years old. He is a father of one child, aged four. He wants a loan for buying fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.  The profits from the business will be used to buy a machine like a small tractor to cultivate a huge area.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
A desire for self-improvement is one of the most important goals for Rehema, who lives with her family in their own house. 

She sells fruits and vegetables at a very strategic sales point. She has many customers who prefer her quality products, low prices, and, above all, excellent service. She is a woman with a lot of potential; a hard-working, dedicated person with many goals to be met.

She is working hard to have a more prosperous future.  She is happy with her business, but knows she must expand to earn more. Lately, she has noticed an increase in demand and wants to make a larger investment to buy more merchandise. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale, and cabbages.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale, and cabbages.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
Jose, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y papaya, en su hogar vive su esposa y dos hijos, el trabajo que realiza lo heredo de su padre, ya que se ha dedicado a esta actividad.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, abono, para tener una mejor cosecha, fortaleciendo y previniendo de las plagas.
El objetivo de Jose es con este préstamo hacer el mejor uso, mas adelante comprarse un camión para transportar y repartir granos básicos.
texts.en: Jose grows corn and papaya. He lives with his wife and two children. He learned his trade from his father, who was a farmer. He is applying for a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and manure to strenghten his plantings and protect them from blight and insects so that he will have a good harvest. This will be the best use of the loan, but later on, Jose wants to buy a truck to transport and deliver grain.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is still managing her fruits and vegetables trading business. Anahit’s children help their mother in her occupation, and thus they support their family. 

Thanks to her first Kiva loan, Anahit was able to buy a large lot of fruits and vegetables for her second rented shop. Now she needs a $ 1,700 loan to repair her second rented shop and also to buy apples and pomegranates to resell.

loans.use: to repair her shop and also to buy apples and pomegranates to resell

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is 25 years old, married to Agneta, and blessed with two children of three years and another, two months old. He sells shoes, a business he started six years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 17,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more shoes for sale. The profit he earns from his business will contribute toward his buying a piece of land and building his own home. 


He hopes to grow his business and create job opportunities in the community, as he would love to be a employer in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Céline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Céline est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un sont à leur charge. Céline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Céline exerce comme activité, la vente d’amuse-gueule qu’elle prépare elle-même (à base de farine de blé et du sucre) ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Céline désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Céline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Fifonsi group has three members who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Céline, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time that this group has requested financial assistance from ALIDé, and they have done so to increase their business levels.

Céline is 37 years of age, and is married to Paul. The couple has three children, all at school and one of whom remains under their care. Céline did not go to school herself, and for almost 15 years has worked selling snacks that she prepares herself (using wheat flour and sugar). This allows her to provide for her family without any great difficulty. 

In order to better meet her customers’ requests, Céline wants to consolidate her business. To do so, along with the other members of the Fifonsi she has requested a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en: Fadwa, 34 years old and a conservative married woman, asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Fadwa is a mother of seven sons and daughters. To help in supporting their big family, Fadwa has recently started to sell make-up products at home. She brought few samples to test her options and decided to apply for this loan to increase the quantity she has.

loans.use: increase the quantity she has of make-up products

loans.name: Fortaleza Bautista Saavedra Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA BAUTISTA SAAVEDRA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, tejido a máquina, tejido de chompas, costura de deportivos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que Pro Mujer, en otra banca comunal; para la iniciación de este grupo fue invitada por una tía que también es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace un año por concejo de una amiga, ya que ella contaba en ese tiempo con un poco de capital.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de las personas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia pues ella es esta casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de el área de salud y crédito y las consulta médicas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “FORTALEZA BAUTISTA SAAVEDRA”  will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal Juan Pablo II. The six members have a board of directors, and Sonia is president. The communal bank´s members have a variety of businesses: running a local store; weaving blankets and sweaters; machine weaving; making sports apparel; and selling food. The loan benefits micro businesses such as Sonia´s. Three years ago, she belonged to another Pro Mujer communal bank. Her aunt, a member of her current group, invited her to join this group. 

Sonia has a local store that she began a year ago on the advice of a friend because she had little money. This loan will provide working capital to buy rice, noodles, and other items from wholesalers to resell in her space. This business allows her to support her family financially; she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sonia said she enjoys the health and loan management training and the medical checkups.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is fifty-three years old and married. He comes from one of the Vulnerable Populations. He has four children between the ages of six and twenty-two years old. His wife is a housewife and stays at home with the children. They all live in a village in the southwestern part of Kosovo under very poor conditions. 

Bajram is a very hardworking man trying to work a lot to get more income for his family. He is working as a guard and sometimes he will transport goods for other people. Life is not so easy for them as for most people that live in all Ashkali communities, living in poverty. 

Bajram is requesting a loan in order to paint the inside and outside of his house. He hopes in the future to improve their living conditions in other ways. 
Bajram and his family are very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To paint the inside and outside of his house.

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.es:
Alejandro, tiene 21 años de edad, está soltero, vive con sus padres, tiene dos hermanos, él se dedica a la carpintería, tiene tres años de poseer el taller, lo aprendió de su padre, lo trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de taladro, sierra eléctrica, que son las herramientas que utiliza en la fabricación de muebles, esta compra ayudara a mejorar la función de la carpintería.
Con el préstamo espera realizar una buena inversión, que le fortalezca el negocio, adquiriendo mas ingresos para ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en: Alejandro is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has two brothers. He is a carpenter and he has had his own workshop for three years. He learned the trade from his father, and he works from Monday to Saturday. He is asking for a loan to buy a drill and electric saw - tools which he uses to make furniture. Buying these will help him to improve the functioning of his carpentry business. He hopes that he can use this loan to make a good investment which will make his business stronger, so that he can increase his income and help his parents out.

loans.use: to buy a drill and electric saw.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is 27 years old, married, and now blessed with one child. He sells maize in a business he started three years ago and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES). 

Nickson wants to purchase more bags of maize and therefore has requested a fourth loan of KES 60,000. The profit he makes from his transactions will help him expand his business.

His dream is to see his business grow big and be able to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is 33 years of age. He is married to Linet and blessed with two children, aged 7 and 2 years respectively. He sells clothes, a business he started 11 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  

He has requested a second loan worth KES 50,000 to purchase bales of trousers and shirts for sale. The profit he earns will help him pay fees for his children. 

His dream is to become a successful businessman as well as to build a modern home.

loans.use: to purchase bales of trousers and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en:
Wesal is a 36-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her. 

She has three sons and a daughter. While her husband is at work and her kids at school, Wesal works on making flowers from plastic and steel strings for sale. Now she has applied for this loan in order to bring in more raw materials to increase the amount of her productivity.

loans.use: to bring in more raw materials for making flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida is from Kobuleti district of west Georgia. She is 47 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Her son serves local people as a driver and gets a monthly income. Zinaida’s husband is a pensioner. 

Zinaida runs the agricultural business. In particular, she has two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. Besides that, the family grows nuts and maize on family-owned land. Zinaida sells her agricultural production at the local open market. She works hard to make some savings and improve living conditions for her family. 

Zinaida requested a loan to purchase food for cattle. She will buy hay and bran to feed the cows during the winter season. When the cows are fed properly in winter, the family will receive a planned amount of milk for the dairy. This will give Zinaida an opportunity to sell more cheese and increase the family income. The increased profit will be reinvested in family agricultural activities. Zinaida awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase hay and bran for feeding the cattle

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have applied for a loan of 23,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Wilfred is leader of this group of borrowers. A native of Magburaka town, Wilfred is 58 years old. He is married to a housewife and he is a father of 14 children, 8 of whom are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Wilfred has been a professional teacher for 39 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, a 36-year-old conservative married woman, asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Amal is a mother of four children. Her husband works and studies at the same time. He is working now on getting a PhD degree in Measurement and Evaluation.

Amal has applied for this educational loan to pay for her husband’s next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her husband’s next semester fees.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en: Nahla is now applying for another loan in order to buy more raw materials for making artificial flowers, as the previous one was used to get different shapes of vases and some requested home products.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Genaro Servellon

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Matagalpa reconocida como la perla del septentrión ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua de gran importancia por su gran calidad y producción de café, en esta bella ciudad habita Genaro Servellon, su estado civil es casado y el núcleo familiar está compuesto por cuatro hijos de los cuales solo uno está estudiando.

Genaro se caracteriza por ser un hombre honrado responsable sobre todo trabajador con el buen ánimo de sacar adelante a su familia.
